Superior Sight.name: Superior Sight
Superior Sight.description:
Your senses are peerless. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks, and you gain low-light vision. If you already have low-light vision, gain darkvision instead. Furthermore, when you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected.

Note: this version of the feat does not modify vision. See @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.YbneCzvDEr76mrsS]{Superior Sight (Darkvision)} or @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.banx3uX4JjjcHEc8]{Superior Sight (Low-Light Vision)} if you need the feature to also grant you a new sense.

Superior Sight (Darkvision).name: Superior Sight (Darkvision)
Superior Sight (Darkvision).description:
Your senses are peerless. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks, and you gain low-light vision. If you already have low-light vision, gain darkvision instead.

Furthermore, when you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}.

Note: this version of the feat grants darkvision automatically.

Superior Sight (Low-Light Vision).name: Superior Sight (Low-Light Vision)
Superior Sight (Low-Light Vision).description:
Your senses are peerless. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks, and you gain low-light vision. If you already have low-light vision, gain darkvision instead.

Furthermore, when you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}.

Note: this version of the feat grants low-light vision automatically.

Supernatural Charm.name: Supernatural Charm
Supernatural Charm.description: The elven magic in your blood manifests as a force you can use to become more appealing or alluring. You can cast 1st-level charm as an arcane innate spell once per day.

Supernatural Senses.name: Supernatural Senses
Supernatural Senses.description: Your scent is preternaturally sharp, and you can always rely on your sense of smell to help guide you when your vision is compromised. When you target a Concealed or Hidden opponent while you are raging, you reduce the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or to 9 for a hidden one.

Supertaster.name: 神之舌 Supertaster
Supertaster.description:
你已经改善了你的味蕾，有了敏锐的味觉，可以察觉到食物和饮料的味道和质地的异常。在吃食物喝饮品时，你可以自动尝试辨别原材料，分辨出是否有调理和例如毒药之类的添加剂。GM根据毒药等级决定DC后，使用你的察觉进行一次暗骰；若成功，你立刻知晓食物或饮品被下毒，但无法得知毒素种类。

若你用舔或尝某物来进行调查（Investigating，探索模式行动）或 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{回忆知识 Recall Knowledge} 检定某物时，若这种浅尝能够获得额外信息（根据GM判断），你在检定中获得+2环境加值。

Suplex.name: Suplex
Suplex.description:
Requirements You have a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Flexing your entire body, you heave your opponent over your head and slam them into the ground. Make an unarmed melee Strike against the creature you have grabbed or restrained; on a success, the target lands @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and on a critical success, the target lands prone and takes an additional [[/r {2d6}[bludgeoning]]]{2d6 bludgeoning damage}. Regardless of whether the Strike is successful, you immediately release your hold on the target.

Supreme Spellstrike.name: 超然法术打击 Supreme Spellstrike
Supreme Spellstrike.description: 法术与物理的结合对于你已经不费吹灰之力。你永久处于 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷}状态。你只可以使用你的额外动作进行打击或再充能法术打击。

Sure Feet.name: Sure Feet
Sure Feet.description: Whether keeping your balance or scrambling up a tricky climb, your hairy, calloused feet easily find purchase. If you roll a success on an Acrobatics check to Balance or an Athletics check to Climb, you get a critical success instead. You're not flat-footed when you attempt to Balance or Climb.

Sure Foot.name: Sure Foot
Sure Foot.description: You know the secrets of moving in your @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain}. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to skill checks to move within your favored terrain, such as Acrobatics checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} on ice, Athletics checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim} in rough water, Acrobatics checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly} in windy conditions, and so forth.

Surface Culture.name: Surface Culture
Surface Culture.description:
Access any surface dwarf ethnicity

Your interactions with other cultures on the surface have not only taught you about many other ancestries, but have also helped you realize the value of your own. You gain the trained proficiency rank in the Society skill (or another skill of your choice if you were already trained in Society), and you gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} skill feat for the Lore corresponding to your culture (for instance, Ouat Lore or Pahmet Lore).

Surface Skimmer.name: Surface Skimmer
Surface Skimmer.description: By sinking gently beneath the waves, you obscure your presence and utilize the water as a barrier between you and land combatants. While you are submerged just below the water's surface, you have cover from attacks made by creatures out of the water.

Surging Focus.name: Surging Focus
Surging Focus.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger An ally you can see falls to 0 Hit Points.

When an ally you can see falls in battle, your fight or flight response triggers a surge in your deity's might within you. You instantly regain 1 Focus Point.

Surging Might.name: Surging Might
Surging Might.description:
With a complex gesture, you focus the divine power of your spell to overcome enemies' resistances. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell, the spell ignores an amount of the target's resistance equal to your level against all the following types of damage: chaotic, evil, good, lawful, negative, and positive.

This applies to all damage the spell deals, including persistent damage and damage caused by an ongoing effect of the spell, such as the positive energy within a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.x5rGOmhDRDVQPrnW]{Field of Life}. This doesn't cause the spell to ignore immunities, only resistances.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: You act before foes can react. On the first round of combat, if you roll Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to you.

Surprise Snare.name: Surprise Snare
Surprise Snare.description:
You install one of your snares prepared for quick deployment in a space that's occupied by an opponent. It must be a snare that normally takes 1 minute or less to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft}.

The snare automatically triggers, but it takes a -2 circumstance penalty to any applicable save DC, as well as any attack rolls or other checks the snare attempts.

Surprise Strike.name: Surprise Strike
Surprise Strike.description: Whenever you make a Strike with an improvised weapon against a creature that hasn't seen you make a Strike using an improvised weapon or that is otherwise ignorant of your skill with improvised weapons, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against you for that Strike.

Surreptitious Spellcaster.name: Surreptitious Spellcaster
Surreptitious Spellcaster.description: You've learned that it pays for a Pathfinder to be able to cast spells without being noticed. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.sIeuPW0j39fTZm08]{Conceal Spell} wizard class feat, though it's not a wizard feat for you. You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks to Conceal a Spell and to Deception checks to conceal verbal components.

Surrounding Flames.name: Surrounding Flames
Surrounding Flames.description: When you cast wall of fire, you can modify its standard effects as follows: Instead of a 5-foot-thick, 10-foot-radius ring of flame, you can form the wall into a 10-foot-radius hemisphere of fire.

Survey Wildlife.name: 荒野见识 Survey Wildlife
Survey Wildlife.description: 你可以通过荒野环境中存在的种种蛛丝马迹判断该区域里有什么类型的生物存在。如果你花费10分钟时间在附近寻找诸如生物巢穴，粪便，以及植被留下的痕迹等线索，在此之后，进行一个生存技能检定（DC由GM决定，取决于附近环境中具体有什么痕迹和明显程度）。如果你的技能检定成功，你可以再进行一个回忆知识检定（承受-2减值）来判断具体在该区域中存在何种生物。当你在生存技能上达到大师级熟练度时，你无视本减值。

Survivor of Desolation.name: Survivor of Desolation
Survivor of Desolation.description: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against unnatural weather events or environmental hazards occurring in blighted or otherwise unnaturally marred regions. If you roll a success on a saving throw against such an effect, you get a critical success instead; if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. This does not apply to unnatural events created or directed by active effects, such as spells that create anomalous weather or hazardous areas.

Suspect of Opportunity.name: Suspect of Opportunity
Suspect of Opportunity.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger A foe takes a hostile action against you in combat.

Sometimes something intrudes upon your case unexpectedly, such as an ambush sent to bring your investigation to a close. You've learned how to compartmentalize your main lead and pursue a new one for your current predicament.

You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.xTK2zsWFyxSJvYbX]{Pursue a Lead} against the triggering foe, setting aside but not ending one of your currently active leads, if you have two leads. At the end of the combat encounter, you stop Pursuing the Lead against the triggering foe and return to the original lead, if you have one.

Sustaining Steel.name: 金本恒久 Sustaining Steel
Sustaining Steel.description:
触发 你使用法术位释放法术

需求 你处于奥术奔涌架式

你将魔法力量拉入到你的武器，利用其物质性来转换魔法为恢复性能量。你恢复数值等同于两倍法术环级的HP并且掷骰来终止任何你得到的 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{持续负能量伤害}。

如果法术是源自死灵学派，任何你得到的持续负能量伤害自动终止，并且如果你愿意的话，你可以将奥术奔涌的伤害类型改为正能量（positive）。（正能量伤害通常只能伤害不死生物 undead 或其他具有 @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.TTCw5NusiSSkJU1x]{负能量治愈 Negative Healing}。）

Svetocher.name: Svetocher
Svetocher.description:
You were born to one of the moroi, the most common vampires, and you share their supernatural fortitude and power of persuasion.

When you have the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} condition, calculate the penalty to your Fortitude saves and your Hit Point reduction as though the condition value were 1 lower.

You are trained Diplomacy. If you would automatically be trained in it, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

Swaggering Initiative.name: Swaggering Initiative
Swaggering Initiative.description:
Trigger You are about to roll initiative.

You swagger readily into any fight-even an ambush. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your initiative roll and can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} to draw a weapon.

Swap Investment.name: Swap Investment
Swap Investment.description:
Frequency once per day

Your time as a Pathfinder has taught you how to improvise, and you've learned to make use of the resources you find in the field. You Invest a magic item and remove a previously invested item. The previous item no longer counts against your limit of 10 invested items.

Swashbuckler Dedication.name: Swashbuckler Dedication
Swashbuckler Dedication.description:
Choose a swashbuckler style. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.LzYi0OuOoypNb6jd]{Panache} class feature, and you can gain panache in all the ways a swashbuckler of your style can.

You become trained in Acrobatics or the skill associated with your style. If you were already trained in both skills, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in swashbuckler class DC. You don't gain any other effects of your chosen style.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the swashbuckler archetype.

Swashbuckler's Riposte.name: Swashbuckler's Riposte
Swashbuckler's Riposte.description: You've learned to riposte against ill-conceived attacks. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EfjoIuDmtUn4yiow]{Opportune Riposte} reaction.

Swashbuckler's Speed.name: Swashbuckler's Speed
Swashbuckler's Speed.description: You move faster, with or without @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.LzYi0OuOoypNb6jd]{Panache}. Increase the status bonus to your Speeds when you have panache to a +10-foot status bonus; you also gain a +5-foot status bonus to your Speeds when you don't have panache.

Swift.name: Swift
Swift.description:
You move with the wind always at your back. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

Special The Speed increase from this feat isn't cumulative with any Speed increase from your ancestry feats (such as Nimble Elf).

Swift Banishment.name: Swift Banishment
Swift Banishment.description:
Trigger You critically hit a creature that is not on its home plane.

Requirements You have a banishment spell prepared

The force of your blow sends your victim back to its home plane. You expend a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} spell you have prepared, affecting the creature you critically hit without needing to cast the spell. The creature can attempt to resist the spell as normal.

Swift Elusion.name: Swift Elusion
Swift Elusion.description:
Trigger A foe ends its movement adjacent to you.

Attempt an Acrobatics check against the foe's Reflex DC. If you succeed, either Stride to a different space adjacent to the foe or move the foe to a different space adjacent to you.

Swift Intervention.name: Swift Intervention
Swift Intervention.description:
Trigger An ally within your overwatch field fails in their attempt to Arrest a Fall, Balance, Grab a Ledge, or Maneuver in Flight

Requirements You are wielding a ranged weapon.

You're burdened with noticing potential threats at all times. Because of this, you've learned that a well-placed shot can prevent disaster. You make a shot to either pin an ally's clothing to stop a fall or secure them against a ledge, or you bounce an attack off their armor to correct their course as they stumble while attempting to balance or fly.

Make a single ranged attack roll against the DC of the triggering check; your ally uses the result of your ranged attack roll in place of their original roll. You must have line of effect to your ally, and your attack roll includes any normal bonuses or penalties for a ranged attack with that weapon (such as the penalty for making a ranged attack beyond your first range increment).

Swift River.name: Swift River
Swift River.description:
Trigger Your turn ends and you have a status penalty to your Speed or are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}

You flow like water, avoiding all restraints. End one status penalty to your speed, or end one immobilized or slowed condition affecting you.

Swift Sneak.name: 迅速潜行 Swift Sneak
Swift Sneak.description: 你可以在潜行（Sneak）时全速移动，并且只要你可以使用以下这些移动方式，你便可以在掘地（Burrowing）、攀爬（Climbing）、飞行（Flying）或是游泳（Swimming）时同时使用潜行。

Swift Swimmer.name: Swift Swimmer
Swift Swimmer.description: You swim faster than most iruxi. Your swim Speed increases to 25 feet.

Swift Tracker.name: Swift Tracker
Swift Tracker.description:
Your keen eyes catch signs of passage even when you're moving. You can move at your full Speed while you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track}.

If you have master proficiency in Survival, you don't need to attempt a new Survival check every hour while Tracking. If you have legendary proficiency in Survival, you can use another exploration activity while Tracking.

If you roll Survival for initiative while tracking your hunted prey, when you start your first turn of the encounter, you can Stride toward your hunted prey as a free action.

Swimming Poppet.name: Swimming Poppet
Swimming Poppet.description: Your fins, flippers, or other accessories assist with steering you through water. You gain a swim Speed of 15 feet.

Swipe.name: Swipe
Swipe.description: You make a wide, arcing swing. Make a single melee Strike and compare the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes, each of whom must be within your melee reach and adjacent to the other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature you hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty. If you're using a weapon with the sweep trait, its modifier applies to all your Swipe attacks.

Sword and Pistol.name: Sword and Pistol
Sword and Pistol.description:
You're comfortable wielding a firearm or crossbow in one hand and a melee weapon in the other, combining melee attacks with shots from the firearm. When you make a successful ranged Strike against an enemy within your reach with your one-handed firearm or one-handed crossbow, that enemy is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against your next melee attack with a one-handed melee weapon.

When you make a successful melee Strike against an enemy with your one-handed melee weapon, the next ranged Strike you make against that enemy with a one-handed firearm or one-handed crossbow doesn't trigger reactions that would trigger on a ranged attack but not a melee attack, such as Attack of Opportunity. Either of these benefits is lost if not used by the end of your next turn.

Swordmaster Dedication.name: Swordmaster Dedication
Swordmaster Dedication.description:
Your Swords training taught you to never lose hold of your weapon. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC when foes attempt to Disarm you. If you have the Deft Cooperation feat and critically succeed on a check to Aid an ally's attack roll or skill check, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus from Deft Cooperation (instead of a +1 bonus) the first time you attempt an attack roll or attempt a skill check where the bonus would apply.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Swordmaster archetype.

Symphony Of Blood.name: Symphony Of Blood
Symphony Of Blood.description: You call forth the blood of your foes to grant you vigor. Once per day, you can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.fd31tAHSSGXyOxW6]{Vampiric Exsanguination} as a 7th-level divine innate spell.

Symphony Of The Unfettered Heart.name: 自由之心交响曲 Symphony Of The Unfettered Heart
Symphony Of The Unfettered Heart.description: 你学会 @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.ZAX0OOcKtYMQlquR]{自由之心交响曲 Symphony of the Unfettered Heart} 组曲法术，它能让你保护一位盟友，对抗失能(incapacitating)状态。

Symphony of the Muse.name: 缪斯交响曲 Symphony of the Muse
Symphony of the Muse.description: 你可以将无数的表演编织为一曲个人交响乐。你不再受到每轮只能激活一个组曲及同时只能激活一个组曲的限制；当你使用一个新的组曲时，之前所有的组曲的效果都会持续到他们的剩余时间结束。

Syncretism.name: Syncretism
Syncretism.description: You have come to see the overlap between two deities' teachings. Choose a second deity. You must meet their alignment requirements, and you are subject to their edicts and anathema. If you are a cloistered cleric, select one of that deity's domains, gaining the benefits of the Expanded Domain Initiate feat with that domain. If you are a warpriest, you gain the favored weapon of that deity as a second favored weapon, and it gains the benefits of feats and abilities you have that affect your deity's favored weapon, such as @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.DfLkIIg2reyYW3a8]{Deadly Simplicity}. If you have a different doctrine than cloistered cleric or warpriest, either apply whichever of the above options is most appropriate for your doctrine, or, at the GM's discretion, add a benefit from the second deity more closely tied to your doctrine.

Synergistic Spell.name: Synergistic Spell
Synergistic Spell.description: You combine your synergy and spells into a fantastic web of magic, allowing you to cast two spells at once. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell from one of your halcyon spell slots, after that spell resolves, you can Cast another Spell as a free action. This spell must be cast from one of your halcyon spell slots and be a spell that would normally take two actions to cast.

Syu Tak-nwa's Deadly Hair.name: Syu Tak-nwa's Deadly Hair
Syu Tak-nwa's Deadly Hair.description: Your hair unarmed attack deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and gains the grapple trait.

Syu Tak-nwa's Hexed Locks.name: Syu Tak-nwa's Hexed Locks
Syu Tak-nwa's Hexed Locks.description: Your hair unarmed attack gains the reach trait. You can deliver hexes through your hair. When you successfully cast a hex focus spell that requires 2 or more actions to cast and that doesn't require a spell attack roll, if your target is within your reach, as part of the spellcasting activity you can make a hair Strike against the foe before applying any effects of the hex. If this Strike misses, the hex has no effect.

Syu Tak-nwa's Skillful Tresses.name: Syu Tak-nwa's Skillful Tresses
Syu Tak-nwa's Skillful Tresses.description: You can expertly control your living hair and use it to perform various tasks. You can perform simple Interact actions with your hair such as opening an unlocked door or picking up objects. Your hair can't perform actions that require fingers or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish. Your hair can hold items of up to 1 Bulk, but can't Activate or attack with any items it's holding.

Tactical Cadence.name: Tactical Cadence
Tactical Cadence.description: Your remarkable breath control and concise instructions allow you to coordinate your allies more effectively. When you grant allies the quickened condition using Cadence Call, they can use the extra action to either Stride or Strike, and they aren't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on their following turn if they use the extra action.

Tactical Debilitations.name: Tactical Debilitations
Tactical Debilitations.description:
You learn new debilitations that grant you tactical advantages against your foes. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.bp0Up04x3dzGK5bB]{Debilitating Strike}.

  • Debilitation The target can't use reactions.
  • Debilitation The target can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking.

Tactical Entry.name: Tactical Entry
Tactical Entry.description:
Requirements You rolled Stealth for initiative in this

encounter, and neither you nor any enemies have acted yet

in this encounter.

You Stride. This movement doesn't trigger any reactions.

Tag Team.name: Tag Team
Tag Team.description:
Trigger You or your spotter misses with a Strike against a creature, and the creature is within the other's melee reach or first range increment.

Your skilled teamwork with your spotter enables you both to assist one another when you falter, using either other's failures as opportunities to strike. If you used Tag Team after your spotter missed the triggering Strike, make a ranged Strike against the same target with a -2 penalty. If you used this reaction after you missed the triggering Strike, your spotter can use their reaction to make a melee or ranged Strike against the same target. Strikes granted by this feat don't count toward your or your spotter's multiple attack penalty and your or your spotter's multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to the granted Strike.

Tail Spin.name: Tail Spin
Tail Spin.description: You excel at using your tail as a weapon to upend your foes. Attempt a single Athletics check to Trip up to two adjacent creatures. If you roll a success against a target, you get a critical success against that target instead.

Tail Whip.name: Tail Whip
Tail Whip.description: By birth or through training, your tail is strong enough to make for a powerful melee weapon. You gain a tail unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and has the sweep trait.

Take the Wheel.name: Take the Wheel
Take the Wheel.description:
Requirements You are adjacent to a vehicle's point of entry.

Diving into a moving vehicle and seizing the controls is nothing new for you. You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.bG91dbtbgOnw7Ofx]{Board} and @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.yh9O9BQjwWrAIiuf]{Take Control} of the adjacent vehicle.

Takedown Expert.name: Takedown Expert
Takedown Expert.description:
You've mastered combat practices that let you get up close and bring down perpetrators alive.

You can use your Intelligence modifier on attack rolls when you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.m0f2B7G9eaaTmhFL]{Devise a Strategem} if you're using a weapon of the club group in one hand (like a club, staff, or sap), in addition to the usual weapons, and those Strikes qualify for your @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.2Fe4YZCvAr9Yf6w7]{Strategic Strike}.

Additionally, you can make any of your Strikes nonlethal without taking the normal -2 penalty.

Talisman Dabbler Dedication.name: Talisman Dabbler Dedication
Talisman Dabbler Dedication.description:
You are trained in the use of talismans and similar magical paraphernalia. This training might have occurred in a formal classroom or been an agglomeration of folk magic picked up over time. You can craft talismans and know the formulas for all common talismans in the Core Rulebook of your level or lower. You remember talisman formulas and don't need a formula book for them.

Additionally, you carry a collection of magical baubles you can turn into temporary talismans. Each day during your daily preparations, you can make two talismans with an item level no higher than half your level. You must know each talisman's formula. A talisman created this way is a temporary item and loses its magic the next time you make your daily preparations if you haven't already used it.

Finally, when you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UAaQk93a30nx0nYY]{Affix a Talisman}, you can (in any combination) affix or remove up to four talismans in the 10-minute span.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the talisman dabbler archetype.

Talismanic Sage.name: Talismanic Sage
Talismanic Sage.description:
You have forgotten more about talismans than lesser warriors have ever known. Normally, affixing more than one talisman to an item causes the talismans to be suppressed, but when you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UAaQk93a30nx0nYY]{Affix a Talisman}, you can specially treat one item you're working on, allowing it to have two active talismans at once.

This special treatment ends if you use Affix a Talisman to treat a new item for this ability.

Tamper.name: 篡改 Tamper
Tamper.description:
你使用一只空闲的手，篡改了敌人的武器或护甲。选择一个你触及内的敌人所持握的武器或穿戴的护甲。尝试一次手艺Crafting检定对抗敌人的反射DC。

大成功 Critical Success 你的篡改非常有效。如果你篡改了武器，敌人在使用该武器进行的攻击骰和伤害骰上承受-2环境罚值。如果你篡改了护甲，护甲会妨碍敌人的移动，令敌人陷入 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{手足无措} 且在速度上承受-10罚值。该效果持续到敌人交互Interact以移除，无论你选择进行何种篡改。

成功 你的篡改暂时有效，如大成功。但效果仅持续到你的下回合开始，即使敌人没有进行交互Interact以移除。

大失败 你的篡改引起了华丽的麻烦，你的工具或器械发生了小规模的爆炸。你承受等于你等级的火焰伤害。

Tandem Movement.name: Tandem Movement
Tandem Movement.description: You and your eidolon move together. You each use a single action to Stride. Either of you that has the corresponding movement type can Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim instead.

Tandem Strike.name: Tandem Strike
Tandem Strike.description:
Requirements A creature is in your and your eidolon's reach.

You and your eidolon each attack, seamlessly targeting the same foe without interfering with each other's movements. Your eidolon makes a melee Strike, and then you make a melee Strike against the same creature. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks have been made.

Tangle Of Battle.name: Tangle Of Battle
Tangle Of Battle.description:
Trigger You critically hit an adjacent enemy.

Your incredibly vicious Strike pulls you right in close, giving you the opportunity to grab your foe. Attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the triggering enemy.

Tangled Forest Rake.name: Tangled Forest Rake
Tangled Forest Rake.description:
Requirements You are in Tangled Forest Stance.

You reposition foes with raking attacks. Make a lashing branch Strike. If you hit and deal damage, you force the target to move 5 feet into a space within your reach. This follows the forced movement rules.

Tangled Forest Stance.name: Tangled Forest Stance
Tangled Forest Stance.description:
Requirements You are unarmored

You extend your arms like gnarled branches to interfere with your foes' movements. You can make lashing branch unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While you're in Tangled Forest Stance and can act, every enemy in your reach that tries to move away from you must succeed at a Reflex save, Acrobatics check, or Athletics check against your class DC or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for that action. If you prefer, you can allow the enemy to move.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.PMHwCrnh9W4sMu5b]{Stance: Tangled Forest Stance}

Target Of Opportunity.name: Target Of Opportunity
Target Of Opportunity.description:
Trigger An ally succeeds at a ranged Strike against an opponent within your weapon's first range increment.

Requirements You have a ranged or thrown weapon in hand.

You capitalize on your ally's attack to create a coordinated barrage.

Make a ranged Strike with a -2 penalty against the opponent targeted by the triggering attack. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

If this Strike is successful, combine the damage from the attack with the damage from your ally's attack for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Targeted Redirection.name: Targeted Redirection
Targeted Redirection.description: You aim a shot at your spotter, intending for your spotter to redirect that shot off their own weapon or shield to hit your foe from a better angle, and avoid your foe's cover. If your next action is to make a ranged Strike, you treat your spotter's position as your own for the purposes of determining cover and range. Your spotter must be within your weapon's first range increment and they must use a reaction to redirect your shot.

Targeting Finisher.name: Targeting Finisher
Targeting Finisher.description:
Your attack harms and hinders your foe. Choose a particular part of your foe from the list below and Strike.

If you hit and damage the target, apply the effect corresponding to the chosen part. This hindrance lasts until the end of your next turn. On a critical hit, you also apply a lesser effect lasting for 1 minute.

  • Arm (or another limb used for attacks, such as a tentacle) The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}. On a critical hit, it is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.
  • Head The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. On a critical hit, it is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.
  • Legs The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds. On a critical hit, it also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute.

Targeting Shot.name: Targeting Shot
Targeting Shot.description: You carefully track your prey's position and defenses, allowing you to follow up around obstacles that block your shot. Make a ranged weapon Strike against your hunted prey. You ignore the target's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition and all cover.

Taste Blood.name: Taste Blood
Taste Blood.description:
You retain not only your vampiric parent's taste for blood but their ability to gain vitality from it. You drink fresh blood from a living humanoid creature, gaining temporary Hit Points equal to the target's level that last for 10 minutes. The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Regardless of the outcome of this save, the target is temporarily immune to your Taste Blood for 1 day; further uses of this ability against the target don't increase the drained condition or grant you more temporary Hit Points.

To drink a creature's blood, either your last action must have been a fangs Strike that damaged the target, or the target must be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and your last action must have been a Strike that dealt piercing or slashing damage to them. If the target is willing, they don't need to be restrained or unconscious for the latter.

Draining the life force from an unwilling humanoid creature is a greater violation than just drinking their blood. Taste Blood has the evil trait unless the target is willing or is an active foe in combat.

Tattoo Artist.name: Tattoo Artist
Tattoo Artist.description:
You can craft tattoos, including magical tattoos. When you select this feat, you gain the formulas for four common magical tattoos of 2nd level or lower.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Crafting checks to Craft tattoos. If you're a master in Crafting, this bonus increases to +2.

Telluric Power.name: Telluric Power
Telluric Power.description: You channel strength from the earth beneath your feet to pummel your enemies. When making a melee Strike against a target who is standing on the same earth or stone surface as you are, you gain a circumstance bonus to the damage roll equal to the number of weapon damage dice.

Tempest-Sun Redirection.name: Tempest-Sun Redirection
Tempest-Sun Redirection.description: If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots that damages other creatures, you can bend some of that spell's offensive energy, protecting allies in the area and boosting your own defenses against certain foes. Select any number of targets of the spell and reduce the spell's damage to those targets by an amount equal to the spell's level. Until your next turn, when one of those targets damages you, that damage is reduced by twice the spell's level.

Tempest-Sun Shielding.name: Tempest-Sun Shielding
Tempest-Sun Shielding.description:
Trigger You or an ally within 30 feet takes damage.

You transform unrealized spell energy into a protective shield. If you're a spontaneous spellcaster, expend a spell slot; if you're a prepared spellcaster, expend a spell prepared in a spell slot. Reduce the triggering damage by an amount equal to four times the level of the expended slot or spell.

Temporary Potions.name: Temporary Potions
Temporary Potions.description:
During your daily preparations, you can create a batch of two temporary oils or potions using a formula you know. These items follow the normal rules to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft}them, except for the time they take, with some additional restrictions. They must both be the same type of oil or potion, and their level must be 6 or more levels lower than your level. Any items you create this way become inert bottles of liquid the next time you make your daily preparations, and any remaining effects of the temporary items end. A temporary oil or potion has no value.

If you have master proficiency in your tradition's spell DCs, you can create a batch of three temporary oils or potions during your daily preparations, and if you have legendary proficiency, you can create a batch of four.

Ten Lives.name: Ten Lives
Ten Lives.description: When your character would die, you can attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, you're instead reduced to 0 HP and a @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} value 1 less than would normally kill you (typically dying 3). This doesn't change the result for any other creature affected.

Tenacious Blood Magic.name: Tenacious Blood Magic
Tenacious Blood Magic.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger You apply an effect from your blood magic that lasts for 1 round.

You have learned how to invest magic more deeply by witnessing Aroden's works. The triggering blood magic effect lasts for 1 minute instead of 1 round.

Tenacious Net.name: Tenacious Net
Tenacious Net.description: Escaping your nets is no simple task. The Athletics DC to Force Open or Escape your nets increases from 16 to 18. After a creature you grabbed with a net Escapes or Forces Open the net, stray strands of the net cling to the creature, causing them to remain @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the beginning of their next turn.

Tenacious Toxins.name: Tenacious Toxins
Tenacious Toxins.description: Your victims tend to expire long before your poisons, since the latter have been specifically formulated to last longer. The maximum duration of any poison you create increases by an amount equal to the poison's stage 1 interval, to a maximum of twice the poison's maximum duration.

Tengu Feather Fan.name: Tengu Feather Fan
Tengu Feather Fan.description:
You've learned to bind some of your feathers together into a fan to focus your ancestral magic. You gain a tengu feather fan: a magic item of light Bulk with a level equal to your level and the evocation and primal traits. You (and only you) can use the tengu feather fan to cast tengu magic. If your fan is lost or destroyed, you can create a replacement during your daily preparations; if you do so, your previous fan falls apart into mundane feathers. Further feats might grant you additional activations of your tengu feather fan, but you can never have more than three activations per day, no matter how many such feats you have. The DC for spells you cast with your tengu feather fan is your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.You can cast the 1st-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.g8QqHpv2CWDwmIm1]{Gust of Wind} spell by activating your tengu feather fan.

Activate Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast one of the spells contained in your tengu feather fan. Activating the fan takes the spell's normal number of actions. You can also Activate the fan to cast a cantrip you've gained from a heritage or ancestry feat; this activation doesn't count against the fan's uses per day.

Tengu Lore.name: Tengu Lore
Tengu Lore.description: You learned skills for surviving in the place where your people were dispersed. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Society and Survival. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Tengu Lore.

Tengu Weapon Expertise.name: Tengu Weapon Expertise
Tengu Weapon Expertise.description: Study has made you an expert with tengu weapons. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency for the weapons from your Tengu Weapon Familiarity.

Tengu Weapon Familiarity.name: Tengu Weapon Familiarity
Tengu Weapon Familiarity.description:
You've trained with a blade and other tengu weapons ever since you hatched. You gain access to @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.KgKSX95uVSg8iBBA]{Khakkaras}.

Additionally, choose two weapons from the sword group. You can choose from among all common martial swords, plus the @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Y1dkRsRd1Z7Jf2y6]{Katana}, @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.NIsxR5zXtVa3PuyU]{Temple Sword}, and @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.YOpopjoWgU7bkmwh]{Wakizashi}. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon, and if the weapon isn't common, you gain access to it. If you are trained in all martial weapons, you add common advanced swords to the swords you can choose from.

You also gain access to all uncommon tengu weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial tengu weapons are simple weapons, and advanced tengu weapons are martial weapons.

Tengu Weapon Study.name: Tengu Weapon Study
Tengu Weapon Study.description: You've learned techniques for using blades and other tengu weapons. Whenever you critically hit using one of the weapons from your Tengu Weapon Familiarity, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.

Tense Negotiator.name: Tense Negotiator
Tense Negotiator.description: You often find that the best way to win a conflict means avoiding a fight in the first place. You're good at talking to potential opponents without making things worse. If you would critically fail at a check to Make an Impression, you instead fail. You can attempt checks to make Requests of creatures who're indifferent or unfriendly toward you.

Terraforming Spell.name: Terraforming Spell
Terraforming Spell.description: You capture transformative fragments of magic and slam them into the ground, creating a shock wave that alters your surroundings. If your next action is to Cast a non-cantrip transmutation Spell, either each space adjacent to you becomes difficult terrain, or each space adjacent to you is no longer difficult terrain. This doesn't have any effect on greater difficult terrain and doesn't remove the damaging effects of hazardous terrain.

Terrain Advantage.name: Terrain Advantage
Terrain Advantage.description: You can take advantage of the terrain to bypass foes' defenses. Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}to you. If you have a swim Speed, non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a swim Speed are also flat-footed to you.

Terrain Expertise.name: Terrain Expertise
Terrain Expertise.description:
你对于某一种特定环境的旅行经验使你在徜徉其中时绝对自信。从以下这些地形环境中选择一种：水域（Aquatic）、极地（Arctic）、荒漠（Desert）、林地（Forest）、山地（Mountain）、平原（Plain）、空域（Sky）、沼泽（Swamp）或是地下（Underground），当你处于该地形环境中时，你在生存技能检定上获得+1环境加值。

特殊 你可以多次选择本专长。每次选择本专长时，你可以选择另一种地形环境获得本专长的好处。

Terrain Expertise (Aquatic).name: Terrain Expertise (Aquatic)
Terrain Expertise (Aquatic).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks in aquatic terrain.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Expertise (Arctic).name: Terrain Expertise (Arctic)
Terrain Expertise (Arctic).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks in arctic terrain.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Expertise (Desert).name: Terrain Expertise (Desert)
Terrain Expertise (Desert).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks in desert terrain.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Expertise (Forest).name: Terrain Expertise (Forest)
Terrain Expertise (Forest).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks in forested terrain.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Expertise (Mountain).name: Terrain Expertise (Mountain)
Terrain Expertise (Mountain).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks in mountainous terrain.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Expertise (Plains).name: Terrain Expertise (Plains)
Terrain Expertise (Plains).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks on plains.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Expertise (Sky).name: Terrain Expertise (Sky)
Terrain Expertise (Sky).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks in the sky.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Expertise (Swamp).name: Terrain Expertise (Swamp)
Terrain Expertise (Swamp).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks in swampy terrain.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Expertise (Underground).name: Terrain Expertise (Underground)
Terrain Expertise (Underground).description:
Your experience in navigating a certain type of terrain makes you supremely confident while doing so. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when underground.

Special You can select this feat more than once, choosing a different type of terrain each time.

Terrain Master.name: Terrain Master
Terrain Master.description: You adapt to your surroundings in any natural terrain. You can spend 1 hour practicing in your current terrain in order to make it your @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain}, replacing your current favored terrain temporarily. If you spend a full day out of the new favored terrain, your favored terrain reverts back to your original choice when you took the Favored Terrain feat.

Terrain Scout.name: Terrain Scout
Terrain Scout.description:
You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.beyw5bdA5hkQbmaG]{Terrain Stalker} skill feat twice, choosing a different terrain each time.

If you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoid Notice} while exploring and any allies use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert} to follow you as you do so, you can choose one of those allies to gain the benefit of any one Terrain Stalker feat you have.

Terrain Shield.name: Terrain Shield
Terrain Shield.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Trigger A Strike would damage you.

Requirements You gained a terrain attunement benefit since the start of your most recent turn and that attunement matches the terrain you're in.

You're so attuned to the land that it rises up to protect you from a potentially fatal blow in a seeming coincidence. For instance, a branch suddenly falls from a nearby tree to take the brunt of a sword swing or a surprising change of current disrupts an enemy's attack. You gain resistance to physical damage equal to double your level against the triggering Strike.

Terrain Stalker.name: 地形潜伏 Terrain Stalker
Terrain Stalker.description:
从以下三种困难地形中选择一种：岩地（Rubble）、雪地（Snow）、灌木丛（Underbrush），当你身处该困难地形并对非盟友的生物视为拥有无踪状态时，你可以无需隐秘技能检定就自动进入潜行状态——前提是你在每次移动时不超过5尺距离，并且在任何时候都不进入任何敌人周围10尺范围以内。在本状态下，只要其他生物没有在积极地寻找你或是处于警戒状态，你也可以自动在探索模式下保持回避注意（Avoiding Notice）状态并进入到该生物周围15尺范围内。

特殊 你可以多次选择本专长。每次选择本专长时，你可以选择另一种困难地形获得本专长的好处。

Terrain Transposition.name: Terrain Transposition
Terrain Transposition.description: You are so connected to the wilderness that you can magically jump from place to place within it. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rtA3HRGoy7PQTOhq]{Terrain Transposition} warden spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Terrified Retreat.name: 破胆威吓 Terrified Retreat
Terrified Retreat.description: 如果你在一次挫败使其技能动作上获得了大成功并且目标的等级比你要低，该目标会开始逃跑（Fleeing）1轮时间。

Terrifying Countenance.name: Terrifying Countenance
Terrifying Countenance.description: You can erect a magical cowl that terrorizes your enemies. Once per day, you can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror} as an innate occult spell, targeting yourself. If you critically hit a creature that's temporarily immune to the spell, the creature's temporary immunity ends.

Terrifying Howl.name: Terrifying Howl
Terrifying Howl.description: You unleash a terrifying howl. Attempt Intimidate checks to Demoralize each enemy within 30 feet. Regardless of the results of your checks, each enemy is then temporarily immune to Terrifying Howl for 1 minute.

Terrifying Resistance.name: 恐吓御敌 Terrifying Resistance
Terrifying Resistance.description: 你成功 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{挫败士气 Demoralize} 的目标所施放的法术对你更难生效。若你成功对目标挫败士气，接下来24小时内你在对抗目标施放的法术时，豁免检定获得+1环境加值。

Tetraelemental Assault.name: Tetraelemental Assault
Tetraelemental Assault.description: Your Elemental Assault cycles through all four elements. When you use Elemental Assault, instead of choosing a single element, you can choose an element from the list when using the action, and then choose a different element at the beginning of each of your next 3 turns without spending an action; once you have chosen an element, you can't choose it again during this Elemental Assault, meaning you must select all four elements over the course of 4 turns. Each time you choose an element, until the beginning of your next turn, your Strikes deal an additional [[/r 1d6]] damage of the indicated type and have the trait corresponding to that element.

That Was a Close One, Huh?.name: That Was a Close One, Huh?
That Was a Close One, Huh?.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Either you used Accidental Shot and hit your opponent with the Strike this turn, or you used Lucky Escape since your last turn and the triggering attack missed you.

You laugh innocently about the inexplicable luck of your last shot hitting its mark or how close the attack that just missed you came to taking your head off, causing your foes to second guess whether it's a good idea to oppose you in battle. Attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} either the foe you hit with Accidental Shot or the foe that missed you due to Lucky Escape. You use Deception instead of Intimidation to attempt the check to Demoralize.

That's Odd.name: That's Odd
That's Odd.description:
When you enter a new location, such as a room or corridor, you immediately notice one thing out of the ordinary. The GM determines what it is, or whether there's nothing reasonable to pick up, skipping obvious clues that can be easily noticed without a check or specifically looking for them. You learn only that an area or object is suspicious, but not why it's suspicious.

For example, if you entered a study with a large bloodstain on the ground, the bloodstain is so obviously suspicious it's evident to you already, so the GM might note that there's something suspicious about the desk drawer instead. You would then need to investigate the drawer further to find out what specifically is out of the ordinary. That's Odd doesn't reveal whether creatures are suspicious.

You don't typically get any benefit when you leave and come back to a place, though if a major change has happened there and time has passed, the GM might determine that you do.

The Harder They Fall.name: The Harder They Fall
The Harder They Fall.description: You make your foes fall painfully when you trip them. When you successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} a @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} foe, your target takes [[/r {1d6}[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage}. On a critical success, the target takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage plus your sneak attack damage.

Theoretical Acumen.name: Theoretical Acumen
Theoretical Acumen.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You succeed at a skill check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.KygTSeDvsFoSO6HW]{Recall Knowledge} to identify a creature.

You study a creature's form and behavior to hypothesize likely means of overcoming its strengths. Once before the end of your next turn, you can use the skill modifier from the triggering check in place of your saving throw modifier against one of the creature's abilities, in place of your Perception modifier to Seek the creature, in place of your Deception modifier to Feint against the creature, or in place of your Intimidation modifier to Demoralize the creature. Alternatively, against one of the creature's attacks, you can use your DC for the skill used in the triggering check in place of your AC.

Thorned Seedpod.name: Thorned Seedpod
Thorned Seedpod.description: When your seedpods strike a felling blow, they burst into viciously thorny vines. When you critically succeed at a seedpod Strike, vines twist and stab your foe, dealing [[/r {1d4}[persistent,piercing]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Piercing Damage}.

Thorough Reports.name: Thorough Reports
Thorough Reports.description: Your reports are thorough and informative, and putting your thoughts to paper helps you retain the information. Keep track of each type of creature you successfully identify with Recall Knowledge. When attempting Recall Knowledge checks against creatures on your list in later encounters, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus, and you learn an additional fact about such creatures on a success.

Thorough Research.name: Thorough Research
Thorough Research.description: When you succeed at a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.KygTSeDvsFoSO6HW]{Recall Knowledge} check, you learn an additional fact about the subject. When you critically succeed at a Recall Knowledge check, you can gain even more additional information or context than normal, at the GM's discretion.

Thorough Search.name: 地毯式搜查 Thorough Search
Thorough Search.description: 你全力以赴进行搜查，保证要找到所以东西。探索模式中进行 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{搜索 Searching}行动时，你可以花费双倍时间进行搜索。通常这意味着搜索时你只有四分之一的速度，每分钟最多前进150尺以求检查所有东西，或每分钟最多前进75尺以在前进前就检查完所有东西。若如此做，你在 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{搜索 Seek}动作中的察觉检定获得+2环境加值。

Thousand Faces.name: Thousand Faces
Thousand Faces.description: Your form is as mutable as the weather, changing to meet your whim. You add the forms listed in @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form} to your wild shape list.

Thrash.name: Thrash
Thrash.description:
Requirements You have a foe @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

You thrash the grabbed foe around. It takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier plus your weapon specialization damage plus your Rage damage. The foe must attempt a basic Fortitude save against your class DC.

Through Spell.name: Through Spell
Through Spell.description:
Spells you cast can transform briefly into vital essence, traveling harmlessly through living and undead creatures between you and your target, blocked only by solid objects.

If the next action you use is to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} that requires a spell attack roll, your targets don't benefit from cover provided by living or undead creatures.

Thrown Voice.name: Thrown Voice
Thrown Voice.description: You've learned how to throw your voice through the winds, tricking others as to your location. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism} as a primal innate spell once per day. If you're a songbird strix, you can cast it twice per day instead.

Thunder God's Fan.name: Thunder God's Fan
Thunder God's Fan.description: A wave of your fan unleashes the fury of the storm. You can Activate your tengu feather fan one additional time per day. Add the 5th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9AAkVUCwF6WVNNY2]{Lightning Bolt} spell to the spells contained within your fan.

Tidal Shield.name: Tidal Shield
Tidal Shield.description:
Frequency once per day

You conjure the force of the tides to gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC until the end of your next turn. Any allies adjacent to you during the duration gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC as long as they remain adjacent to you. You can Sustain the effect to a maximum duration of 5 rounds. When a creature receiving a circumstance bonus to AC from Tidal Shield would take damage from an attack, as a reaction, you can reduce the damage to that creature by 40; after you do so, Tidal Shield ends.

Tide-hardened.name: Tide-hardened
Tide-hardened.description: You're at home in the unpredictable tides. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against cold and water effects. If you roll a success on a save against a cold or water effect, you get a critical success instead.

Tiger Slash.name: Tiger Slash
Tiger Slash.description:
Requirements You are in @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.VCjAlOvjNvFJOsG5]{Tiger Stance}

You make a fierce swipe with both hands. Make a tiger claw Strike. It deals two extra weapon damage dice (three extra dice if you're 14th level or higher), and you can push the target 5 feet away as if you had successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoved} them.

If the attack is a critical success and deals damage, add your Strength modifier to the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} from your tiger claw.

Tiger Stance.name: Tiger Stance
Tiger Stance.description:
Requirements You are unarmored

You enter the stance of a tiger and can make tiger claw attacks. These deal 1d8 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

On a critical success with your tiger claws, if you deal damage, the target takes [[/r {1d4}[persistent,bleed]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

As long as your Speed is at least 20 feet while in Tiger Stance, you can Step 10 feet.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.pf9yvKNg6jZLrE30]{Stance: Tiger Stance}

Tiller's Aid.name: Tiller's Aid
Tiller's Aid.description: You can use the Aid reaction to help a member of your crop even if you haven't prepared to do so.a

Tiller's Drive.name: Tiller's Drive
Tiller's Drive.description:
Your Speed bonus from Bellflower Dedication increases to +10 feet. Members of your crop receive a +5-foot circumstance bonus to Speed.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.4alr9e8w9H0RCLwI]{Effect: Tiller's Drive}

Time Dilation Cascade.name: Time Dilation Cascade
Time Dilation Cascade.description: You borrow a bit of time from the future to act now. Make six Strikes. Your multiple attack penalty applies normally to these Strikes. If you successfully hit a creature with multiple Strikes, combine those Strikes' damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. On your next turn, you regain 1 action instead of 3. This is before any alteration in your actions due to the quickened, slowed, and stunned conditions.

Timeless Body.name: Timeless Body
Timeless Body.description: You cease aging. In addition, you gain a +2 status bonus to saving throws against poisons and diseases, and you gain resistance to poison damage equal to half your level.

Timeless Nature.name: Timeless Nature
Timeless Nature.description: With primal magic sustaining you, you cease aging. The overflowing primal energy gives you a +2 status bonus to saves against diseases and primal magic.

Tinkering Fingers.name: Tinkering Fingers
Tinkering Fingers.description: You're good with your hands and can quickly improvise a fix for broken or damaged equipment. You're trained in Crafting. If you would automatically become trained in Crafting (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair} an item without using a repair kit without taking the -2 circumstance penalty, improvising tools from whatever you have at hand.

Titan Slinger.name: Titan Slinger
Titan Slinger.description: You have learned how to use your sling to fell enormous creatures. When you hit on an attack with a sling against a Large or larger creature, increase the size of the weapon damage die by one step.

Titan Wrestler.name: 巨人摔角术 Titan Wrestler
Titan Wrestler.description: 你可以尝试对体型比你大最多两级的生物使用 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{卸武 Disarm}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{擒拿 Grapple}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{推撞 Shove}或 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{摔绊 Trip} 动作。当你在运动技能上达到传奇级熟练度时，你可以尝试对体型比你大最多三级的生物使用这些动作。

Titan's Stature.name: Titan's Stature
Titan's Stature.description:
You grow to even greater size. When using Giant's Stature, you can instead become Huge (increasing your reach by 10 feet if you were Medium or smaller) while you are raging. You have the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} condition as long as you are Huge.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.RcxDIOa68SUGyMun]{Effect: Titan's Stature}

To Battle!.name: To Battle!
To Battle!.description: With a resounding cry, you rally your ally to the offensive. Choose one ally within your marshal's aura who has a reaction available. If you spend 1 action, that ally can use their reaction to immediately Stride. If you spend 2 actions, that ally can use their reaction to immediately Strike.

To the Ends of the Earth.name: To the Ends of the Earth
To the Ends of the Earth.description:
Your ability to track your prey has surpassed explanation, allowing you to trace your prey's movements and predict its location with ease.

When you use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JYi4MnsdFu618hPm]{Hunt Prey} on a creature within 100 feet, you can follow that creature's movements, allowing you to know the creature's exact location no matter how far away it becomes, as long as it remains your prey.

You must be legendary in Nature to track your prey's location across teleportation or planar travel. This feat gains the detection, divination, and primal traits if you're legendary in Nature.

Tomb-Watcher's Glare.name: Tomb-Watcher's Glare
Tomb-Watcher's Glare.description: When you critically hit an undead creature, or an undead creature critically fails a saving throw against one of your abilities, you drive your divine wrath home in your enemy's heart. The undead is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

Tongue Disarm.name: Tongue Disarm
Tongue Disarm.description: You lash out with your tongue to disarm your foe. You attempt to Disarm a creature within 10 feet, ignoring the requirement that you must have at least one hand free.

Tongue Tether.name: Tongue Tether
Tongue Tether.description: Your tongue can momentarily latch on as readily as your hands. So long as you can freely open your mouth, you do not need free hands in order to Disarm, Grab an Edge, or Trip. If you have the Long Tongue feat, you can Disarm, Grab an Edge, and Trip with your tongue at a distance that is 5 feet beyond your normal reach.

Tongue of Sun and Moon.name: Tongue of Sun and Moon
Tongue of Sun and Moon.description: You have transcended the barriers between words and meaning. You can speak and understand all spoken languages.

Tools Of The Trade.name: Tools Of The Trade
Tools Of The Trade.description:
You're well-versed in weapons that allow you to bring bounties in alive. You are trained with the following weapons: @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.YUzPv0i8d8p2J9yx]{Bola}, @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.TLQErnOpM9Luy7rL]{Sap}, and @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.f1gwoTkf3Nn0v3PN]{Whip}. You gain access to bolas. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the weapons listed.

In addition, you take no penalty when making a nonlethal attack with a weapon without the nonlethal trait.

Topple Foe.name: Topple Foe
Topple Foe.description:
Trigger An ally succeeds at a melee Strike against an opponent you are both adjacent to.

You take advantage of the opening created by your ally to tip your foe off their feet. Attempt an Athletics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the target of the triggering attack.

Topple Giants.name: Topple Giants
Topple Giants.description:
When you observe an ally try and fail to execute a strategic maneuver against your enemies, you coordinate with your other allies to finish the job, using the opening from the first attempt to keep your foe off-balance and ensure your eventual success.

When an ally within your overwatch field attempts to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} an opponent within your overwatch field and fails, you coordinate efforts to provide a +2 circumstance bonus to the next Athletics check rolled by a different ally to attempt the same action on the same target before that target's next turn.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.W8HWQ47YNHWB8kj6]{Effect: Topple Giants}

Toppling Dance.name: Toppling Dance
Toppling Dance.description: While sharing a creature's space using Dance Underfoot, your weapons and unarmed attacks gain the trip trait, but only against the creature whose space you share. You can be in the same space as a Large or larger prone creature, even if it's not your ally.

Toppling Tentacles.name: Toppling Tentacles
Toppling Tentacles.description: When you cast black tentacles, replace the spell's standard effects with the following: Tentacles slither along the ground in the area, attempting to hinder anyone within. Sticky black tentacles attempt to Trip each creature in the area. Attempt spell attack rolls against the Reflex DCs of each affected creature. Any creature you succeed against is knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and takes [[/r {3d6}[bludgeoning]]]{3d6 bludgeoning damage}. Whenever a creature ends its turn in the area, the tentacles attempt to Trip that creature if it isn't already prone, and they deal [[/r {1d6}[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage} to any creature already prone. Creatures treat the spell's area as difficult terrain.

Torch Goblin.name: Torch Goblin
Torch Goblin.description: You've spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage. You can light yourself thoroughly on fire with a held torch, a bottle of alchemist's fire, or a similar incendiary, dealing yourself [[/r {1d6}[persistent,fire]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}. As long as you are suffering @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}, all your melee attacks against adjacent creatures deal an additional 1 fire damage per weapon damage die. Any creature that successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapples}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoves}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trips} you takes 1d6 fire damage; if it uses a weapon for that action, the weapon takes the damage instead. You must still attempt the flat check to remove the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage} each round, as normal.

Touch Focus.name: Touch Focus
Touch Focus.description: You can redirect a spell's power through you to deliver it within striking distance. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with 1 or more targets and a range farther than touch, you can change the range to touch. If the altered spell requires a spell attack roll, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack. This only allows you to touch a single target with the spell, even if the spell originally affected more than 1 target. After you Cast the Spell, you can Disarm, Shove, Trip, or Strike the target with an unarmed attack.

Tough Tumbler.name: Tough Tumbler
Tough Tumbler.description: You've taken your share of licks while scurrying around the battlefield and know how to defend yourself against opportunistic attackers. Your movement ends only when you critically fail an Acrobatics check to Tumble Through an enemy's space (or when you don't have enough Speed to move all the way through its space). You still trigger reactions on a failure to Tumble Through, but you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against attacks that you trigger in this way.

Toughness.name: 健壮 Toughness
Toughness.description: 你可以承受惊人的创伤而不倒下。你的最大生命值会额外提升相当于你的等级的数值。稳定伤势检定的DC 等于9+濒死状态值。

Towering Size.name: Towering Size
Towering Size.description: Your eidolon becomes even bigger. It becomes Huge, instead of Large, and the reach on all its attacks increases to 15 feet.

Tracing Sigil.name: Tracing Sigil
Tracing Sigil.description: When you cast sigil, you can modify the spell to add the following to its standard effects: The target leaves a magical trail that you and others can try to follow. You and other creatures can attempt to Track the target, substituting an Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion check (whichever matches the magical tradition of your sigil spell) for the Survival check. Much like Tracking with Survival, this must take place somewhere the target has been and follow the trail; it doesn't allow anyone to find the target from a distance. You can only have a single target marked with a modified sigil in this way. If you use this ability again on a second target, the sigil spell on the first target ends, and your mark fades.

Trailblazing Stride.name: Trailblazing Stride
Trailblazing Stride.description: You are used to moving through the wilderness. While moving on land, you ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain.

Train Animal.name: 训练动物 Train Animal
Train Animal.description:
你可花费时间教授动物接受使用一些特定动作的指令。你可以选择教授动物一个它本身就理解如何进行的基础动作（Basic Action，见技能章节的指挥动物行动）或是教给它一个全新的基础动作。DM决定教授这个动作给一只动物所需的技能检定DC和所需的具体时间（通常至少要一周时间）。一般而言，动物不可能学会任何需要它们进行深入思考判断的行动。如果你在自然技能上达到专家/大师或传奇熟练等级，GM也许会允许你向更加珍奇的动物教授动作。

成功动物学会了你教给它的动作。如果这个动作它本来就理解如何使用，你现在可以用指挥动物技能动作要求它进行该动作而无需自然技能检定；若这是一个它新学会的动作，你可以将它加入你使用指挥动物行动所能要求动物进行的动作列表，但必须骰自然技能检定来尝试要求动物进行它们。

失败 动物没学会你教它的新玩意。

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description:
Your eidolon Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures at least one size smaller, Trampling each creature whose space it enters. It can attempt to Trample the same creature only once in a single Trample.

It deals bludgeoning damage equal to the damage of its secondary attack against these creatures, which can attempt a basic Reflex save against your spell DC.

Trampling Charge.name: Trampling Charge
Trampling Charge.description:
Requirements You are riding a mount that has a melee Strike using its legs (claw, talons, hoof, etc.).

You urge your mount forward, trampling enemies in your path. You command your mount to Stride up to its Speed (or to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim}, if it has the corresponding movement type), moving through the spaces of any foes in your path up to one size smaller than your mount.

Your mount deals damage equal to the melee Strike using its legs to each creature whose space you move through, subject to a basic Reflex save against your mount's Athletics DC. On a critical failure, the creature also becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the end of your next turn. You can damage a given creature only once during this movement.

Tranquil Sanctuary.name: Tranquil Sanctuary
Tranquil Sanctuary.description: Whenever possible, you follow the serene path and encourage others to do the same. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8xRzLhwGL7Dgy3EZ]{Sanctuary} once per day as a 1st-level divine innate spell.

Transcribe Moment.name: Transcribe Moment
Transcribe Moment.description: You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.NxOYiKCqcuAHVRCj]{Transcribe Moment} focus spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by spending 10 minutes to study a text or record notes on your recent experiences.

Translucent Skin.name: Translucent Skin
Translucent Skin.description: Your body is translucent while underwater. Whenever you are fully submerged in water, you can Hide from other creatures even if you don't have cover against them and aren't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from them.

Transpose.name: Transpose
Transpose.description:
You switch places with your eidolon. You each teleport to the other's position.

Special This feat has the trait matching your eidolon's tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Trap Finder.name: Trap Finder
Trap Finder.description:
You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to the dangers and presence of traps. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps, to AC against attacks made by traps, and to saves against traps. Even if you aren't @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching}, you get a check to find traps that normally require you to be Searching. You still need to meet any other requirements to find the trap.

You can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of master in Thievery. If you have master proficiency in Thievery, you can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of legendary instead, and your circumstance bonuses against traps increase to +2.

Trapsmith Dedication.name: Trapsmith Dedication
Trapsmith Dedication.description:
You use glimmering gears and gnashing mechanisms to manufacture snares using specialized parts. Your snares include clockwork and steam-powered cogwheels and gears, and their gush of steam can hinder those you ensnare. If you choose to construct a snare using gears and a creature fails their saving throw against the snare, all creatures are concealed to that creature for 1 round, as a burst of steam obscures its vision.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the snarecrafter or trapsmith archetypes.

Treacherous Earth.name: Treacherous Earth
Treacherous Earth.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

You have the power to shatter the earth into a shape of your devising. You crack the ground beneath you, creating difficult terrain in a 5-foot burst centered on one corner of your space.

Treat Condition.name: Treat Condition
Treat Condition.description:
Requirements You are holding healer's tools, or you are wearing them and have a hand free.

You treat an adjacent creature in an attempt to reduce the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition. If a creature has multiple conditions from this list, choose one.

Attempt a counteract check against the condition, using your Medicine modifier as your counteract modifier and the condition's source to determine the DC.

You can't treat a condition that came from an artifact or effect above 20th level unless you have Legendary Medic; even if you do, the counteract DC increases by 10.

Treating a Condition that is continually applied under certain circumstances (for instance, the enfeebled condition a good character gains from carrying an unholy weapon) has no effect as long as the circumstances continue.

Critical Success Reduce the condition value by 2.

Success Reduce the condition value by 1.

Critical Failure Increase the condition value by 1.

Tree Climber (Elf).name: 爬树能手(精灵) Tree Climber (Elf)
Tree Climber (Elf).description: 你在树梢上过了大半辈子，是快速且安全地在树上攀爬的行家里手。你获得10尺的 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{攀爬} 速度。

Tree Climber (Goblin).name: Tree Climber (Goblin)
Tree Climber (Goblin).description: Your time in forest or jungle canopies has taught you how to scramble across branches with sure feet. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet. If you also have the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.bo4JG09pkoS7ywSZ]{Cave Climber} ancestry feat, your total climb Speed increases to your land Speed when climbing trees.

Triangle Shot.name: Triangle Shot
Triangle Shot.description:
Requirements You are in @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.YG2RxXE9SMfwo6wP]{Monastic Archer Stance} and wielding a bow usable with that stance.

You string three arrows to your bow and fire them all at once. Make three ranged Strikes against a single target with the required weapon, each using your current multiple attack penalty, and you take an additional -2 penalty. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty, and you combine the attacks' damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Your @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.8bMmGBO6gsMfWZk3]{Stunning Fist} benefit applies to Triangle Shot, even though it isn't a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.nbfNETdpee8CVM17]{Flurry of Blows}. If all three Strikes hit, the target takes [[/r {3d6}[persistent,bleed]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Triangulate.name: Triangulate
Triangulate.description: Your spotter's quick signals help you make even difficult shots seem simple. As long as both you and your spotter can see the target of your attacks, you don't take a penalty for attacking within your weapon's second range increment. The penalty you take for firing into further range increments is -3 for the third range increment, with an additional -2 penalty for each additional increment beyond the third (-5 for the fourth range increment, -7 for the fifth, and -9 for the sixth).

Trick Driver Dedication.name: Trick Driver Dedication
Trick Driver Dedication.description:
You are equally at home piloting any vehicle, adapting yourself instantly to varied controls, movements, and handling. Whenever piloting a vehicle requires a Piloting Lore or Sailing Lore check, you can use your Driving Lore proficiency instead. You can use Dexterity in place of Intelligence when attempting piloting checks with Driving Lore. You become an expert in Driving Lore. At 7th level, you become a master in Driving Lore, and at 15th level, you become legendary in Driving Lore.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the trick driver archetype.

Trick Magic Item.name: 巧取魔法物品 Trick Magic Item
Trick Magic Item.description:
你分析了一件魔法物品的运行机制，即使你本身不具备使用它的条件，你也可以用取巧的方法暂时激活它。举例来说，这个专长可以让不会施法的战士临时使用一下魔杖，或是让法师施放一个不在他的法术列表上的法术卷轴。你必须理解一件魔法物品激活后会产生的具体效果才能尝试取巧。

你使用对应该魔法物品的魔法宗派，或是其中记载法术的魔法宗派的技能进行检定；如果你要使用该物品施放一个法术，使用以下对应法术宗派的技能检定：奥术-奥法，原能-自然，异能-神秘，神术-宗教，或是其中任何一个技能（如果该物品的魔法力量不属于任何魔法宗派）。GM会根据该物品的物品等级决定技能检定的DC（可能会根据该物品的特性和局体情景调整）。

如果你要启动的一件魔法物品需要骰法术攻击检定或是法术DC，而你并不具有施放该魔法宗派的法术的属性条件，则使用你的人物等级作为使用该效果的熟练等级，以及你在智力、感知或魅力中最高一项的属性调整值。

如果你在对应魔法宗派的技能上达到了大师级熟练度，那么你可以使用“受训”熟练加值进行检定；如果你在对应魔法宗派的技能上达到了传奇级熟练度，那么你可以使用“专家”熟练加值进行检定。

成功 在本回合中，你可以使用接下来的动作启动该魔法物品，如同你本来就可以使用它一样。

失败 你不能使用该魔法物品或是尝试巧取它。但在你的下个回合你可以再试试。

大失败 你不能使用或尝试巧取该魔法物品，直到次日你的每日准备为止。

Trick Shot.name: Trick Shot
Trick Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a loaded crossbow or firearm.

You shoot not at your foe but at an object nearby. Make a Strike with your firearm against an AC equal to an easy DC for your level. On a success, instead of hitting your foe, your attack hits an object behind or to the side of your target, creating one of the following effects. The GM might determine that a different AC is appropriate or that a particular effect isn't a valid option, such as using the explosive barrel option when there's no such object on the battlefield. The GM should inform you if a Trick Shot is feasible before you spend your actions, since your trained eye can easily recognize loose or volatile objects.

  • Dislodge Object Your attack knocks an unattended object of no more than 2 Bulk out of position, moving it up to 10 feet in a direction of your choice. For example, the weapon could knock a wizard's crystal ball off a table.
