Ward Against Corruption.description: Your soul is warded against the power of undeath and plague, as well as that of the evil former psychopomps known as sahkils. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against death effects, disease, and all effects from undead or sahkils. This bonus increases to +2 against an undead or sahkil's death effect or disease.

Ward Casting.name: Ward Casting
Ward Casting.description:
Trigger You attempt a flat check for Steady Spellcasting, but you haven't rolled yet.

You carefully ward your spell by drawing from a mantle of magical energy you prepared to protect your casting, increasing your chance of retaining the spell. You reduce the DC of the flat check for Steady Spellcasting from 15 to 10.

Ward Medic.name: 医护长 Ward Medic
Ward Medic.description: 你可以照料一整个病房的病人，同时满足每一个伤患所需要的治疗。当你使用治疗疾病或是治疗伤害技能动作时，你可以同时为两个对象提供治疗；当你在医疗技能上达到大师级熟练度时，你可以同时为四个对象提供治疗；当你在医疗技能上达到传奇级时，你可以同时为八个对象提供治疗。

Ward Mind.name: Ward Mind
Ward Mind.description:
Requirements You're currently affected by a mental effect that you gained by failing, but not critically failing, a saving throw.

Trigger Your turn ends.

To protect the knowledge within your mind from intrusion or erasure, you ward yourself against a mental attack, temporarily delaying its effects. Until the end of your next turn, you ignore a single mental effect that meets the requirement. You can suppress a particular effect using Ward Mind or Cognitive Loophole only once, even if you have both feats.

Special You can use this reaction even if the mental effect prevents you from using reactions.

Warden's Boon.name: Warden's Boon
Warden's Boon.description:
By pointing out vulnerabilities, you grant the benefits listed in @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JYi4MnsdFu618hPm]{Hunt Prey} and your@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.mzkkj9LEWjJPBhaq]{Hunter's Edge} benefit to an ally until the end of their next turn. Depending on whether you call out or use gestures, this action gains either the auditory or visual trait.

  • @Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.uXCU8GgriUjuj5FV]{Effect: Hunter's Edge, Flurry}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.ltIvO9ZQlmqGD89Y]{Effect: Hunter's Edge, Outwit}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.mNk0KxsZMFnDjUA0]{Effect: Hunter's Edge, Precision}

Warden's Focus.name: Warden's Focus
Warden's Focus.description: Your connection with your surroundings grows deeper as you focus. If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OSefkMgojBLqmRDh]{Refocused}, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

Warden's Guidance.name: Warden's Guidance
Warden's Guidance.description:
You can convey your prey's location to your allies, no matter how well hidden it is.

As long as your hunted prey is observed by you, all your allies who roll failures and critical failures when @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeking} it get a success instead.

Your allies need to be able to see or hear you to gain this benefit. You have to be able to call out or use gestures for your allies to get this benefit.

Warden's Step.name: Warden's Step
Warden's Step.description: You can guide your allies to move quietly through the wilderness. When you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoid Notice} during exploration in natural terrain, you can designate any number of your allies to gain the benefits as if they were using that activity during that exploration. This requires no action on their part.

Warden's Wellspring.name: Warden's Wellspring
Warden's Wellspring.description: You command unparalleled focus when you commune with the world around you. If you have spent at least 3 Focus Points since the last time you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OSefkMgojBLqmRDh]{Refocused}, you recover 3 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

Warding Light.name: Warding Light
Warding Light.description:
You gain a tattoo that serves as a special ward to defend you against Walkena's forces.

The tattoo allows you to cast the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} cantrip as a divine innate spell at will. The cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. If you die, the tattoo immediately casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Gentle Repose} on your corpse, heightened to the same spell level.

Warding Rune (Abjuration).name: Warding Rune (Abjuration)
Warding Rune (Abjuration).description: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic. Choose a school of magic other than divination. You gain a rune on your body corresponding to that school, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against effects of that school.

Warding Rune (Conjuration).name: Warding Rune (Conjuration)
Warding Rune (Conjuration).description: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic. Choose a school of magic other than divination. You gain a rune on your body corresponding to that school, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against effects of that school.

Warding Rune (Enchantment).name: Warding Rune (Enchantment)
Warding Rune (Enchantment).description: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic. Choose a school of magic other than divination. You gain a rune on your body corresponding to that school, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against effects of that school.

Warding Rune (Evocation).name: Warding Rune (Evocation)
Warding Rune (Evocation).description: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic. Choose a school of magic other than divination. You gain a rune on your body corresponding to that school, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against effects of that school.

Warding Rune (Illusion).name: Warding Rune (Illusion)
Warding Rune (Illusion).description: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic. Choose a school of magic other than divination. You gain a rune on your body corresponding to that school, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against effects of that school.

Warding Rune (Necromancy).name: Warding Rune (Necromancy)
Warding Rune (Necromancy).description: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic. Choose a school of magic other than divination. You gain a rune on your body corresponding to that school, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against effects of that school.

Warding Rune (Transmutation).name: Warding Rune (Transmutation)
Warding Rune (Transmutation).description: Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic. Choose a school of magic other than divination. You gain a rune on your body corresponding to that school, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against effects of that school.

Warning Shot.name: Warning Shot
Warning Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a loaded firearm.

Who needs words when the roar of a gun is so much more succinct? You attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a foe by firing your weapon into the air, using the firearm's maximum range rather than the usual range of 30 feet. This check doesn't take the –4 circumstance penalty if the target doesn't share a language with you.

Warren Digger.name: Warren Digger
Warren Digger.description: You've learned to put your sturdy claws to work digging through the earth. You gain a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} Speed of 15 feet.

Warren Friend.name: Warren Friend
Warren Friend.description: You're adept at making contact with other ysoki. When you arrive at a new settlement, you automatically find the nearest ratfolk enclave by spending 1 day of downtime searching, provided one exists and its members aren't actively hiding from you. Once you've made contact, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Gather Information and Earn Income in the settlement.

Warren Navigator.name: Warren Navigator
Warren Navigator.description: You're particularly good at solving mazes and navigating twists and turns. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Survival. If you would automatically become trained in Survival (from your background or class, for example), you become trained in another skill of your choice. When you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{Sense Direction} or attempt a roll against a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze} spell, you get a result one degree of success better than you rolled. You don't take a penalty to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{Sense Direction} when you lack a compass.

Wary Disarmament.name: 谨慎解除 Wary Disarmament
Wary Disarmament.description: 如果你在解除一件装置或是陷阱时意外触发了它，你会在对抗这件装置或陷阱对你的攻击时在AC和豁免检定上获得+2环境加值。只有你因为解除装置失败而触发的那一次攻击时这个专长的加值才会生效，而后续的任何效果——比如一个多重触发的复杂陷阱——不会获得这个好处。

Wary Skulker.name: Wary Skulker
Wary Skulker.description: Ever alert, you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.kV3XM0YJeS2KCSOb]{Scout} for danger even when you are trying to stay hidden. You can perform the Scout exploration activity at the same time as the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoid Notice} exploration activity.

Wash Out.name: Wash Out
Wash Out.description: Toxins seep out of your artificial body quickly. Each time you succeed at a Fortitude save against an ongoing poison, you reduce its stage by 2, or by 1 against a virulent poison. Each critical success you achieve against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 against a virulent poison.

Watch Your Back.name: Watch Your Back
Watch Your Back.description:
You menace the target, stoking their fears and drawing their attention.

Attempt an Intimidation check against the Will DC of a target within 30 feet. If you succeed, for 1 minute, that target gains a +2 status bonus to Perception checks against you, but they take a -2 status penalty to Will saves against fear effects.

Watch and Learn.name: Watch and Learn
Watch and Learn.description:
Trigger An ally you can see succeeds or critically succeeds at a Strength- or Dexterity-based skill check, using a skill in which you are untrained.

Pathfinder agents serve as members of diverse teams with complementary skill sets. You are practiced at following the example of a more skilled ally to accomplish a wide variety of tasks. For the next minute you can add your level as a proficiency bonus to the observed skill check, even though you are untrained. This does not allow you to attempt trained actions using that skill unless you would otherwise be able to do so.

Watchful Gaze.name: Watchful Gaze
Watchful Gaze.description: You use your many eyes to look in all directions at once, making you extremely observant for a short period of time. You gain all-around vision until the start of your next turn. This lets you see in all directions and prevents you from being flanked.

Watchful Halfling.name: Watchful Halfling
Watchful Halfling.description: Your communal lifestyle causes you to pay close attention to the people around you, allowing you to more easily notice when they act out of character. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when using the Sense Motive basic action to notice enchanted or possessed characters. If you aren't actively using Sense Motive on an enchanted or possessed character, the GM rolls a secret check, without the usual circumstance and with a -2 circumstance penalty, for you to potentially notice the enchantment or possession anyway. In addition to using it for skill checks, you can use the Aid basic action to grant a bonus to another creature's saving throw or other check to overcome enchantment or possession. As usual for Aid, you need to prepare by using an action on your turn to encourage the creature to fight against the effect.

Water Conjuration.name: Water Conjuration
Water Conjuration.description: You carry the ocean with you wherever you go. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water} as a primal innate spell once per day. Each time you cast create water, you choose if you create fresh water or salt water.

Water Dancer.name: Water Dancer
Water Dancer.description: You glide through the water with graceful ease. When in an aquatic or swamp environment, you ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. In addition, swimming up or down isn't difficult terrain for you.

Water Sprint.name: 踏浪 Water Sprint
Water Sprint.description:
经验和训练告诉你，水有足够的表面张力让大师踏浪而行。

当你以一条直线行走时，若至少一半速度是在地面上，则剩下的速度可以用在液体上移动。若行走结束时未出在坚实地面上，你依然会掉入水里。

若你运动技能为传奇，则只要你在坚实地面上开始行走，剩下的行走部分都可在水面上移动，不走一条直线也没关系，当然，行走结束时若未处于坚实地面，还是会掉入水中。

Water Step.name: Water Step
Water Step.description: You can Stride across liquid and surfaces that don't support your weight. This benefit lasts only during your movement. If you end your movement on a surface that can't support you, you fall in or it collapses as normal.

Water Strider.name: Water Strider
Water Strider.description: Water cradles your every step, allowing you to walk on its surface. Stride up to your Speed. During your movement, you can move across liquids that don't support your weight. If you end your movement on a surface that can't support you, you fall into the liquid at the end of your movement. You can increase the number of actions to 3 to Stride up to three times your Speed.

Wave Spiral.name: Wave Spiral
Wave Spiral.description:
Frequency once per minute

Requirements You're in Reflective Ripple Stance.

You dip and spin, unleashing a wide whirlpool of water. Make an Athletics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} each creature standing on the ground in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10].

These attacks all count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you make all the attacks.

Wavetouched Paragon.name: Wavetouched Paragon
Wavetouched Paragon.description:
You have been blessed by the sea, granting you the ability to swim like a fish. You gain a 15-foot swim Speed.

Special If you have the Bonuwat Wavetouched background, you can take this feat at 1st level instead of 5th.

Waxed Feathers.name: Waxed Feathers
Waxed Feathers.description: Your feathers are coated in a waxy substance that repels water. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against effects that have the water trait. So long as you're in a dry place, you can spend one action to shake off any water that clings to your clothing and feathers to instantly become dry.

Wayfinder Resonance Infiltrator.name: Wayfinder Resonance Infiltrator
Wayfinder Resonance Infiltrator.description: You are adept at using the unusual resonance of your wayfinder to aid in any deceptions you might employ. Once per day you can activate your wayfinder to cast illusory disguise, heightened to 2nd level, as an arcane spell. Additionally, once per day, you can Activate your wayfinder with a single-action envision activation to transform it into a perfect replica of another similarly sized badge of membership or office, such as an Aspis Consortium badge. This transformation lasts for 1 hour.

Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer.name: Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer
Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer.description: You can use the unusual resonance of your wayfinder to grant it additional effects. Choose one cantrip from the arcane, divine, occult, or primal list. You can activate your wayfinder to cast that cantrip at will. As normal, this cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. Additionally, you can Activate your wayfinder with a Single Action (envision) activation to transform it into a nondescript pin or brooch to hide your affiliation with the Pathfinder Society. This transformation lasts for 1 hour.

We March On.name: We March On
We March On.description: You make sure that your allies push themselves while traveling. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.5ZsmRm7HvFAw2XDZ]{Caravan Leader} and @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.38uOVS8fLZxraUrg]{Pick Up The Pace} general feats, even if you don't meet the prerequisites.

Weapon Improviser Dedication.name: Weapon Improviser Dedication
Weapon Improviser Dedication.description:
You don't take the normal -2 penalty to attack rolls with improvised weapons. Additionally, whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency with any weapon, you also gain that proficiency with improvised weapons.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the weapon improviser archetype.

Weapon Proficiency.name: 武器擅长 Weapon Proficiency
Weapon Proficiency.description:
你现在获得对所有的简单武器（Simple Weapons）的受训。如果你已经在所有的简单武器上受训，你获得所有军用武器（Military Weapons）的受训。如果你已经在所有的军用武器上受训，你获得一件你所选的进阶武器（Advanced Weapons）的受训

特殊 你可以多次选择本专长。每次选择本专长时，你可以获得新的武器受训，按照本专长效果所述的提升步骤。

Weapon Supremacy.name: Weapon Supremacy
Weapon Supremacy.description: Your skill with weapons lets you attack swiftly at all times. You're permanently @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. You can use your extra action only to Strike.

Weapon-Rune Shifter.name: Weapon-Rune Shifter
Weapon-Rune Shifter.description: You learn how to alter the magic of weapon runes by using a crystal as a focusing component. Once per day during your daily preparations, you can focus on a rune's magical energies through a crystal's facets to alter a single property rune on one weapon in your possession to suppress its normal effects and make it function as a different property rune. You can temporarily alter the rune to function as one of the following runes: corrosive, flaming, frost, ghost touch, grievous, returning, shock, thundering, or wounding. The property rune remains altered until you make your next daily preparations. The weapon must meet the prerequisites for the temporary rune, and any other runes that required the suppressed rune are also suppressed while the rune is transformed. The rune is obviously altered, and thus the weapon can't be sold as though it had the temporary rune.

Web Hunter.name: Web Hunter
Web Hunter.description: Through the careful cultivation of highly sensitive hairs, you've developed the ability to sense creatures without seeing them. You gain imprecise tremorsense at a range of 15 feet. When you and a creature are both touching the same anchored, threadlike object (such as a rope, webbing, or wire), your imprecise tremorsense can sense that creature at a range of 60 feet.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: You have plenty of practice navigating webs. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saves and AC against the web spell, natural webbing, and effects that entrap you in webbing, as well as a +1 circumstance bonus against other effects that snare and entangle you, like the entangle spell. Whenever you roll a success on a saving throw against an effect involving a web, you get a critical success instead.

Web Weaver.name: Web Weaver
Web Weaver.description:
You can produce a soft silk to weave into useful items. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.dTjzxCy9pku5gL0F]{Specialty Crafting (Weaving)} feat.

You can use your webbing to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} simple, nonconsumable threaded items, such as clothing and rope, at zero cost as long as their base Price is 1 sp or less. These items have no resale value, and they naturally degrade after 24 hours without regular (if minor) maintenance. You can maintain up to 10 such items at a time; if you create a new one, your oldest creation breaks down from neglect.

These temporary items take you only 1 day to Craft instead of 4. If you're an expert in Crafting, you can Craft these items in 1 hour; if you're a master, you can Craft them in 10 minutes; if you're legendary, you can Craft them in 1 minute.

Webslinger.name: Webslinger
Webslinger.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Your natural ability to create silken webs blends with your magical powers, allowing you to create impossibly large webs with great frequency. This has the effects of a 2nd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9s5tqqXNzcoKamWx]{Web} spell using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

Weight of Guilt.name: 负罪之重 Weight of Guilt
Weight of Guilt.description: 负罪感笼罩在那些忽视你救赎瞥视的敌人心中。你可以选择取代给触发反应动作的生物造成力竭（Enfeebled）2，令其在同样的时间内承受呆滞（Stupefied）2。

Weighty Impact.name: Weighty Impact
Weighty Impact.description: Your eidolon knocks enemies down. Choose one of the eidolon's unarmed attacks with the trip trait. It gains the @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown} action for that attack.

Well-Groomed.name: Well-Groomed
Well-Groomed.description:
You are fastidious about keeping yourself clean, whether licking your fur or carefully using traditional catfolk hygiene products, to salubrious effect.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against diseases. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a disease, you get a critical success instead.

Well-Met Traveler.name: Well-Met Traveler
Well-Met Traveler.description:
You have seen people from so many walks of life in your travels that you naturally adopt a pleasant and affable demeanor when meeting others. You are trained in Diplomacy. If you would automatically become trained in Diplomacy (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

In addition, you gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.4RjDxgvNXNl5GG9d]{Hobnobber} skill feat.

Note: If you are already trained in the skill provided by this feat, you need to manually select an alternative skill.

Well-Versed.name: 内行看门道 Well-Versed
Well-Versed.description: 你对非你的表演影响有一定的抵抗力。你在对抗有听觉、幻术、语言学、音波或视觉特征的效果时，在豁免检定上获得+1环境加值。

Wellspring Control.name: Wellspring Control
Wellspring Control.description: When you generate a wellspring surge, roll twice on the Wellspring Surges table and take the result of your choice. This doesn't apply when you cause another creature to generate a wellspring surge.

Wellspring Mage Dedication.name: Wellspring Mage Dedication
Wellspring Mage Dedication.description:
There's no longer a limit on how many temporary spell slots you can gain per day from wellspring magic.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you gain two other feats from the wellspring mage archetype.

Westyr's Wayfinder Repository.name: Westyr's Wayfinder Repository
Westyr's Wayfinder Repository.description:
Requirements You have at least one 1st-level spell slot and a wayfinder.

You can use your wayfinder to store a little extra magic for when you need it most. When making your daily preparations, you can choose one 1st-level spell from your spellbook or spell repertoire and store it in your wayfinder. You can cast this spell from the wayfinder using the normal actions required. Once the spell has been cast, it is expended, and you must make your next daily preparations to store another spell in your wayfinder.

Wheedle and Jig.name: Wheedle and Jig
Wheedle and Jig.description: You make capering motions and silly sounds to captivate onlookers. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.IihxWhRfpsBgQ5jS]{Enthrall} as a 3rd-level arcane innate spell once per day.

Whirling Blade Stance.name: Whirling Blade Stance
Whirling Blade Stance.description:
You enter a mindful stance that creates a deep connection between you and your monk weapons, allowing you to manipulate them with your ki even at a distance.

All melee Monk weapons you wield with the finesse trait gain the thrown 10 feet trait (unless they already have the thrown trait with a greater range).

Once you've made a thrown Strike with such a weapon, you can use the precision of your throw to make additional Strikes with it, even from a distance. Start from the space of the previous Strike's target to determine the range increment and whether the new target has cover. At the end of your turn, the thrown weapon flies directly back to you in a straight line. If a solid barrier blocks its path, it falls to the ground after hitting the barrier.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.JefXqvhzUeBArkAP]{Stance: Whirling Blade Stance}

Whirling Knockdown.name: Whirling Knockdown
Whirling Knockdown.description:
Requirements You're wielding a loaded one-handed firearm and a one-handed melee weapon.

You fire your gun while throwing off a target's balance with your melee weapon. Then, you topple your foe to the ground with the quick orchestrated combination. You don't need to use brute force to do so, or even necessarily to hit with your gunshot; the effect is all about performing perfectly and eliminating your target's movements and options, leaving them no choice but to fall.

Make a ranged firearm Strike against a creature within the reach of your melee weapon and then attempt a Performance check against the creature's Reflex DC. If the Strike critically succeeds, the target takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its Reflex DC against this check. The Performance check has the following effects.

Critical Success The target falls and lands @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. It takes [[/r {2d6}[bludgeoning]]]{2d6 bludgeoning damage} from the fall.

Success The target falls and lands prone.

Critical Failure Your plans backfired on you, and you're forced to drop your melee weapon in your space.

Whirling Throw.name: Whirling Throw
Whirling Throw.description:
Requirements You have a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

You propel your grabbed or restrained foe a great distance. You can throw the creature any distance up to 10 feet, plus 5 feet × your Strength modifier. If you successfully throw the creature, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier plus 1d6 per 10 feet you threw it.

Attempt an Athletics check against the foe's Fortitude DC. You take a -2 circumstance penalty to your check if the target is one size larger than you and a -4 circumstance penalty if it's larger than that. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check if the target is one size smaller than you and a +4 circumstance bonus if it's smaller than that.

Critical Success You throw the creature the desired distance and it lands @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Success You throw the creature the desired distance.

Failure You don't throw the creature.

Critical Failure You don't throw the creature, and it's no longer grabbed or restrained by you.

Whirlwind Spell.name: 奥术狂风 Whirlwind Spell
Whirlwind Spell.description:
需求 你的法术打击已充能（charged）

你将一个多目标法术（multitarget spell）的能量与狂风骤雨般的攻击结合。你进行法术打击，对你触及范围内所有敌人而不是单一敌人都进行一次近战打击。如果你的法术可以影响多个目标，则你的法术影响到所有你命中的敌人，而不是第一个目标，最多为法术通常的最多目标数。如果你打击的敌人多于法术可以选择的数量，选择哪些敌人受到法术影响。每次打击都会计算你的多重攻击减值，但是直到你完成所有打击为止不会增加你的减值。

如果你根据 @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.84n92oBsRVCxjifM]{拓展法术打击} 使用一个区域法术进行法术打击时，按照扩展法术打击的描述应用区域，选择你打击的生物之一来决定区域以及法术是否因为打击大失败而失效。如果你根据扩展法术打击使用一个指向性法术（targeted spell）进行法术打击时，如果每次打击都大失败则法术完全失效，但是法术不会因为单次大失败而完全失效。

你只能在近战打击（melee Strikes）时使用这一动作，即使你拥有星火流矢融汇研究（starlit span hybrid study）或类似能力也不行。

Whirlwind Stance.name: Whirlwind Stance
Whirlwind Stance.description:
Requirements You are wielding your staff, which must have the parry trait.

You use your staff as a defensive implement as well as an offensive one. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC as long as you remain in this stance.

Whirlwind Strike.name: Whirlwind Strike
Whirlwind Strike.description: You attack all nearby adversaries. Make a melee Strike against each enemy within your melee reach. Each attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty, but do not increase your penalty until you have made all your attacks.

Whirlwind Toss.name: Whirlwind Toss
Whirlwind Toss.description:
Requirements You have a foe grabbed.

You whirl a foe to smash into all nearby creatures before throwing them far away in imitation of the techniques of your rival, Ran-To. You Thrash. During this Thrash, your @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.WY7CjISdz6uwXwIb]{Collateral Thrash} feat applies to all foes adjacent to you. You can then throw the grabbed creature 10 feet, where they fall @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

If the foe you choose for Collateral Thrash is also adjacent to you, they attempt only one save and take the damage only once.

Whodunnit?.name: Whodunnit?
Whodunnit?.description:
Frequency once per day

You carefully consider your case and narrow down some of the details. When you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.xTK2zsWFyxSJvYbX]{Pursue a Lead}, you can spend 10 minutes instead of 1 minute to ask two questions of the GM as you complete the activity.

The GM must answer truthfully with "yes" or "no," though if the answer would be misleading or have no practical application to your investigation the GM can answer "immaterial." You can't use Whodunnit? more than once for the same lead, even across different days.

Your questions must come from the following list, applying to either the creature or the clue you found:

  • Was the clue left by a [creature trait]? (Choose a creature trait such as humanoid, undead, or dwarf; this trait must be accurate as of the time the clue was left.)
  • Was this clue left within the last hour?
  • Was this clue left within the last day?
  • Was the creature that left the clue in a heightened emotional state when it left the clue?
  • Did the creature attempt to conceal this clue?

Wholeness of Body.name: Wholeness of Body
Wholeness of Body.description: You can restore your health by tapping into your ki. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qJZZdYBdNaWRJFER]{Wholeness of Body} ki spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Wide Overwatch.name: Wide Overwatch
Wide Overwatch.description: Through a variety of perceptive techniques, careful routines, and upgrades to your enhanced visual gear, you have become able to observe and maintain your overwatch at a much greater distance. Increase the size of your overwatch field from 30 feet to 60 feet.

Widen Spell.name: 扩展法术 Widen Spell
Widen Spell.description: 你能操纵你法术的能量，让它能影响更广的区域。如果你下个动作是 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{施放法术 Cast a Spell} ，然后它的区域是爆发、圆锥或线型，并且没有持续时间，你就可以增加该法术的区域。如果爆发半径最短有10呎的法术，你可以把它的半径额外加5呎(如果连爆发10呎半径都没有，该法术不受影响)。 如果圆锥或线型长度最长是15呎或15呎以内的法术，你可以把它的长度额外加5呎，如果是长度超过15呎的圆锥或线型，那额外加10呎。

Widen the Gap.name: Widen the Gap
Widen the Gap.description: Once you have penetrated a foe's defenses, you can home in on the same spot to exploit your opponent's wound and deal some serious damage. The second time you hit and deal damage with a melee axe Strike to the same opponent or object during your turn, you ignore half of the opponent's or object's Hardness, if any. If you hit and deal damage with a melee axe Strike to the same opponent or object a third or fourth time during your turn, you ignore all of its Hardness, if any.

Wild Empathy.name: Wild Empathy
Wild Empathy.description: You have a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows you to communicate with them on a rudimentary level. You can use Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on animals and to make very simple @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of them. In most cases, wild animals will give you time to make your case.

Wild Lights.name: Wild Lights
Wild Lights.description: When you cast dancing lights, you can modify its duration to be 1 minute and modify its standard effects to create a single floating light in the shape of a Tiny creature, instead of up to four floating lights. The creature hovers over your head unless you spend a single action that has the concentrate trait to direct the light to move up to 30 feet, in which case it remains there until you direct it again. If you direct it back to your head, it hovers there and follows you again until you direct it elsewhere. If the light ever moves beyond 120 feet of you, it winks out immediately.

Wild Shape.name: Wild Shape
Wild Shape.description: You are one with the wild, always changing and adapting to meet any challenge. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8RWfKConLYFZpQ9X]{Wild Shape} order spell, which lets you transform into a variety of forms that you can expand with druid feats.

Wild Strider.name: Wild Strider
Wild Strider.description: Natural obstacles pose no obstacle to you. You gain the ranger's @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.RlwE99yKnhq8FUuy]{Wild Stride} class feature. This allows you to ignore the effects of all non-magical difficult terrain, treat greater difficult terrain as merely difficult terrain, and gives you an additional benefit from @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.sgo7J9BVofBqwlsF]{Favored Terrain} based on the terrain.

Wild Winds Gust.name: Wild Winds Gust
Wild Winds Gust.description:
Requirements You are in @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.SkarN4VlNxSJSJNw]{Wild Winds Stance}

You store up energy and release it in an enormous gust of rushing wind. Make a wind crash Strike against each creature in your choice of a 30-foot cone or a 60 foot line. These attacks all count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you make all the attacks.

Wild Winds Initiate.name: Wild Winds Initiate
Wild Winds Initiate.description:
You learn a mystical stance that lets you attack from a distance. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.SkarN4VlNxSJSJNw]{Wild Winds Stance} ki spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

While entering the stance is a ki spell, the wind crash Strikes the stance grants are not, so you can use them as often as you like while in the stance.

Wildborn Adept.name: Wildborn Adept
Wildborn Adept.description: The whispers of the jungle grant you more diverse access to simple primal magic. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kl2q6JvBZwed4B6v]{Dancing Lights}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kcelf6IHl3L9VXXg]{Disrupt Undead} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]{Tanglefoot} as innate primal spells at will. If you chose one of those spells with Wildborn Magic, you can select a new spell for Wildborn Magic.

Wildborn Magic.name: Wildborn Magic
Wildborn Magic.description:
Access Mualijae ethnicity

You have learned to access the old magic of wild places. Choose one cantrip from the primal spell list. You can cast this cantrip as an innate primal spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.

Wilderness Spotter.name: Wilderness Spotter
Wilderness Spotter.description:
Select one type of terrain from the following list: aquatic, arctic, desert, forest, mountain, plains, sky, swamp, or underground. You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in the selected terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter. You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in the chosen terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Aquatic).name: Wilderness Spotter (Aquatic)
Wilderness Spotter (Aquatic).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in aquatic terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in aquatic terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Arctic).name: Wilderness Spotter (Arctic)
Wilderness Spotter (Arctic).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in arctic terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in arctic terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Desert).name: Wilderness Spotter (Desert)
Wilderness Spotter (Desert).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in desert terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in desert terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Forest).name: Wilderness Spotter (Forest)
Wilderness Spotter (Forest).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in forested terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in forested terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Mountain).name: Wilderness Spotter (Mountain)
Wilderness Spotter (Mountain).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in mountainous terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in mountainous terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Plains).name: Wilderness Spotter (Plains)
Wilderness Spotter (Plains).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when on plains in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations on plains; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Sky).name: Wilderness Spotter (Sky)
Wilderness Spotter (Sky).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in the sky in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in the sky; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Swamp).name: Wilderness Spotter (Swamp)
Wilderness Spotter (Swamp).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in swampy terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in swampy terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Wilderness Spotter (Underground).name: Wilderness Spotter (Underground)
Wilderness Spotter (Underground).description:
You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when underground in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter.

You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations when underground; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

Willing Death.name: Willing Death
Willing Death.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger An ally within 30 feet takes damage that would otherwise reduce them to 0 Hit Points and give them the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition.

Once, you died because you valued someone else's life above your own; just as then, you protect an ally by suffering in their stead. Reduce the damage the triggering ally would take by 1 + your level. You redirect this damage to yourself, but your immunities, weaknesses, resistances, and so on don't apply. You aren't subject to any conditions or other effects from whatever damaged your ally (such as poison from a venomous bite)—your ally is still subject to those effects even if you redirect all of the triggering damage to yourself. If the redirected damage prevents the ally from being reduced to 0 Hit Points, they remain conscious and don't gain the dying condition.

Special You can select this feat only at 1st level, and you can't retrain into or out of this feat.

Wind Caller.name: Wind Caller
Wind Caller.description: You bid the winds to lift and carry you through the air. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gSFg9zKwgcNZLMEs]{Stormwind Flight} order spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Wind God's Fan.name: Wind God's Fan
Wind God's Fan.description: Your fan can stir up even more powerful winds. You can Activate your tengu feather fan one additional time per day. Add the 3rd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.it4ZsAi6XgvGcodc]{Wall of Wind} spell to the spells contained within your fan.

Wind Jump.name: Wind Jump
Wind Jump.description: You gather the wind beneath you, allowing you to soar as you jump. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kRxlkPPe6Gr7Du59]{Wind Jump} ki spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Wind Tempered.name: Wind Tempered
Wind Tempered.description: You are at home in tempestuous weather and accustomed to even the harshest winds. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against air and electricity effects. If you roll a success on a save against an air effect, you get a critical success instead.

Wind-Tossed Spell.name: Wind-Tossed Spell
Wind-Tossed Spell.description:
You enhance your spell with elemental air, using the wind to find your target and carry your magic around cover.

If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that requires a spell attack roll, you ignore the target's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition and any cover they have from you.

The spell gains the air trait.

Winding Flow.name: Winding Flow
Winding Flow.description:
Frequency once per round

Any journey consists of more than simply reaching your destination. You use two of the following actions in any order: Stand, Step, and Stride. You can't use the same action twice.

Wing Step.name: Wing Step
Wing Step.description: With a sharp flap of your wings, you stay light on your feet as you move. You Step 5 feet twice.

Winglets.name: Winglets
Winglets.description: You're among the few kobolds who grow a set of draconic wings later in life. The wings are initially small and weak; while not enough for full flight, a strong flap allows you to jump further. When Leaping horizontally, you move an additional 5 feet (this additional distance isn't cumulative with the increased Leap distance from the Powerful Leap feat). You don't automatically fail your checks to High Jump or Long Jump if you don't Stride at least 10 feet first. In addition, when you attempt a Long Jump, you can jump a distance up to 10 feet longer than you normally would based on the result of your Athletics check, though you still can't jump farther than your Speed.

Wings Of Air.name: Wings Of Air
Wings Of Air.description:
Frequency once per day

You can strain to call forth feathered or cloudy wings from your back. Once manifested, these wings remain for 10 minutes. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed while you've manifested your wings.

Wings Of The Dragon.name: Wings Of The Dragon
Wings Of The Dragon.description: You can manifest draconic wings to soar through the air at great speed. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HWJODX2zPg5cg34F]{Dragon Wings} sorcerer bloodline spell and a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. If you already have a focus pool, increase your number of Focus Points by 1.

Winter Cat Senses.name: Winter Cat Senses
Winter Cat Senses.description: Your eyes are keen and accustomed to winter conditions. You ignore concealment caused by ice and snow.

Wish Alchemy.name: Wish Alchemy
Wish Alchemy.description:
You have learned Artokus Kirran's most hidden secrets, granting you the ability to create alchemy infused with the power of wishes.

Once per day when you use @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Pe0zmIqyTBc2Td0I]{Advanced Alchemy} during your daily preparations, you can spend a batch of infused reagents to create a wish vial containing a single common arcane spell of your choice of 8th level or lower.

The spell must have a casting time of no more than 3 actions, no Cost, and must be able to target you. Only you can Activate the wish vial, which takes the same number of @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} actions as the spell's casting time and grants you the effects of the spell.

Witch Dedication.name: Witch Dedication
Witch Dedication.description:
You cast spells like a witch. Choose a patron; you gain a familiar with two common cantrips of your choice from your chosen patron's tradition, but aside from the tradition, you don't gain any other effects the patron would usually grant. Your familiar has one less familiar ability than normal.

You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} activity. You can prepare one cantrip each day from your familiar. You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs from your patron's tradition. Your key spellcasting ability for witch archetype spells is Intelligence, and they are witch spells of your patron's tradition.

You become trained in the skill associated with the patron's tradition; if you were already trained in it, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the witch archetype.

Witch Warden.name: Witch Warden
Witch Warden.description:
Access Kellid ethnicity

You and your family have fought long and hard against witches, particularly the winter witches of Irrisen, and you've learned to be wary of their curses and the otherworldly powers their patrons grant. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against curses, and to saving throws against spells cast by a witch or hag. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a curse or a spell cast by a witch or hag, you get a critical success instead.

Witch's Bottle.name: Witch's Bottle
Witch's Bottle.description:
You spend 10 minutes and 1 Focus Point brewing a special potion containing the power of one of your hexes that targets a creature. A creature that consumes this potion is targeted by the hex.

If the hex has a sustained duration and you have @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.YVK3JUkPVzHIeGXQ]{Cackle}, you can cast cackle into the bottle just before you seal it. If you do, the hex's duration is extended as if you had cast cackle the round after the hex was cast (typically this extends the duration by 1 round). Your cackling laugh sounds out when the potion is unsealed.

Any potion you create this way loses its power the next time you make your daily preparations. While the potion is in your possession, you can render it inert using a single action that has the concentrate trait. You can't regain the Focus Point you spent to create the potion (or the Focus Point you spent to cast cackle) until the potion is consumed or loses its magic.

Witch's Charge.name: Witch's Charge
Witch's Charge.description:
You forge a magical link with another creature, granting you awareness of that creature's condition and creating a conduit for spellcasting.

During your daily preparations, you can designate one willing creature as your charge. You are always aware of your charge's direction from you, its distance from you, and any conditions affecting it. In addition, you can cast spells with a range of touch on your charge from a range of 30 feet. These effects persist until your next daily preparations.

Special This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.ugeStF0Rj8phBPWL]{Effect: Witch's Charge}

Witch's Communion.name: Witch's Communion
Witch's Communion.description: You can keep watch over multiple charges. Each day during your preparations, you can designate a number of charges equal to your Intelligence modifier instead of just one.

Witch's Hut.name: Witch's Hut
Witch's Hut.description:
Your home is an animated structure that obeys your commands. By performing a rite that takes 1 day, you create an animated object from a hut, small house, covered wagon, tent, or similar construction of up to Huge size.

The hut uses your AC, saving throw modifiers, and Perception modifier and has 150 HP and Hardness 10. It has the construct armor ability, meaning once it's reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its AC is reduced by 4 until it is repaired.

The hut can't attack or attempt skill checks. You can give the hut a command as a single action, which has the auditory and concentrate traits; after 1 round of reconfiguring itself, the hut then follows that command until you give it a different command.

  • Guard The hut watches for trespassers within 120 feet using your Perception modifier and screams if it spots any.
  • Lock Each entrance to the hut is sealed with a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Azoh0BSoCASrA1lr]{Lock} spell.
  • Move The hut gains a Speed of 60 feet, growing giant bird or bone legs, if necessary, and follows an extremely basic movement command you give it, such as "follow me" or "move that direction." While perfectly suitable for overland travel, the hut's broad movements and 1-round delay on response time are too imprecise to predictably direct in a combat encounter or other situation where seconds and precise locations count.
  • Hide The hut appears to be a normal, mundane object of its type. This is a 10th-level illusion effect.

You can have only one hut at a time. If you animate a new hut, your previous hut immediately reverts to its original, mundane form. If you die, the hut continues following the last order you gave it indefinitely.

Wizard Dedication.name: 法师入门 Wizard Dedication
Wizard Dedication.description:
你像一个法师一样施法。你获得施法Cast a Spell行动。你获得一本法术书，记录了自选的四个常见的奥术戏法。你每天可以从你的法术书中准备两个戏法。你在奥术的法术攻击骰和法术DC中受训。你在法师变体法术中的施法主属性是智力Intelligence，可以施展的是奥术根源的法师法术。你在奥法Arcana中受训；如果你已经在奥法Arcana中受训，你在另一个你自选的技能中受训。

特殊 你不能选择其他入门专长，除非你从法师变体中获得了其他两个专长。

Wolf Drag.name: Wolf Drag
Wolf Drag.description:
Requirements You are in @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.AN9jY1JVcU20Qdw6]{Wolf Stance}

You rip your enemy off their feet.

Make a wolf jaw Strike. Your wolf jaw gains the fatal d12 trait for this Strike, and if the attack succeeds, you knock the target @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Wolf Stance.name: Wolf Stance
Wolf Stance.description:
Requirements You are unarmored

You enter the stance of a wolf, low to the ground with your hands held like fanged teeth. You can make wolf jaw unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 piercing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, backstabber, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

If you're flanking a target while in Wolf Stance, your wolf jaw unarmed attacks also gain the trip trait.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.b2kWJuCPj1rDMdwz]{Stance: Wolf Stance}

Woodcraft.name: Woodcraft
Woodcraft.description: You have a innate familiarity with forested areas. When in a forest or jungle environment, if you roll a critical failure on a Survival skill check to Sense Direction, Subsist, or Cover Tracks, you get a failure instead, and if you roll a success, you get a critical success instead.

Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
Woodland Stride.description: You can always find a path, almost as if foliage parted before you. You ignore any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede your progress.

Words of Unraveling.name: Words of Unraveling
Words of Unraveling.description: You have unlocked abstruse methods to tangle with reality itself, altering the fate of a single individual. Once per day as an occult innate spell, you can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dARE6VfJ3Uoq5M53]{Daydreamer's Curse}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.APDrC83QljsyHenB]{Savant's Curse}. At the GM's discretion, you can substitute or add additional occult curse spells of 4th level or lower to this list. You can choose a different spell from the list each time you use this ability. If you couldn't already cast occult spells, these spells use Intelligence as your spellcasting ability, and you become trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for occult spells; if you could already cast occult spells, your proficiency in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for occult spells increases to expert.

Work Yourself Up.name: Work Yourself Up
Work Yourself Up.description:
Requirements You have a reaction available and aren't prevented from using @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2424g94rpoiN1IPh]{Catharsis}.

You concentrate on your mental state, tapping into that raw emotional energy. Take your Catharsis reaction, causing the catharsis activation and entering your emotional fervor as normal. The fervor lasts only until the end of your turn. At the end of your emotional fervor, you experience the effects of your emotional fallout, as normal.

Worldsphere Gravity.name: Worldsphere Gravity
Worldsphere Gravity.description:
Frequency once per hour Though creating demiplanes usually requires lengthy rituals, you know how to establish minor planar effects in imitation of Syndara's masterpieces. If your next action is to Cast a Spell of at least 5th level from your spell slots that affects an area, you can apply one of the following planar effects to a 20-foot burst centered within the spell's area. The effect persists for 1 minute.

Gravitational Morass The pull of gravity is amplified here, creating greater difficult terrain. Flying creatures that pass through the area must succeed at a Reflex save against your spell DC or fall to the ground, taking bludgeoning damage equal to half the distance fallen.

Flowing Time Erratic timestreams aid you within this space. A creature that starts its turn in the burst is affected by @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste} on that turn.

Wortwitch.name: Wortwitch
Wortwitch.description:
You have a particular affinity for leafy plants.

Your patron grants you a leshy familiar. If you already had a familiar, this leshy replaces your previous familiar, as if your previous familiar had been slain.

In addition, you gain the ability to see through leaves, vines, and other foliage. You don't take circumstance penalties to ranged spell attacks or Perception checks caused by foliage, and your targeted attacks don't require a flat check to succeed against a target @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} only by such vegetation.

Wounded Rage.name: Wounded Rage
Wounded Rage.description:
Trigger You take damage and are capable of entering a rage

You roar in pain, awakening the rage within you. You Rage.

Wrestler Dedication.name: Wrestler Dedication
Wrestler Dedication.description:
Your training in the wrestling arts has made you particularly adept at moving, striking, and grappling while unencumbered. You become an expert in Athletics and gain the Titan Wrestler skill feat. You don't take the -2 circumstance penalty for making a lethal attack with your nonlethal unarmed attacks. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude DC when resisting an opponent's attempts to Grapple you or Swallow you Whole.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the wrestler archetype.

Wronged Monk's Wrath.name: Wronged Monk's Wrath
Wronged Monk's Wrath.description: You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8TBgEzjZxPaOJOm1]{Wronged Monk's Wrath} ki spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Wyrmbane Aura.name: 逐龙灵光 Wyrmbane Aura
Wyrmbane Aura.description:
需求 屠龙誓约 Dragonslayer Oath

你的灵光能提供对抗毁灭性能量和龙族吐息的保护。你和你周围15内的盟友获得等同于你魅力调整值的针对酸液、寒冷、电击、火焰和毒素伤害的抗力。如果这些类型的伤害的来源是龙息，那么这些抗力会提升至你等级的一半。

Wyrmling Flight.name: Wyrmling Flight
Wyrmling Flight.description: Your draconic wings have grown large and strong enough for flight. You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed, using your wings to stay aloft.

Yamaraj's Grandeur.name: Yamaraj's Grandeur
Yamaraj's Grandeur.description:
Frequency once per day

You have been granted a sliver of the power of the yamaraj, the magistrates of the dead who agreed to allow duskwalkers to exist at all. You exhale a blast of icy wind and ravenous insects. This is a 30-foot cone that deals [[/r {14d6}[slashing]]]{14d6 slashing damage} and [[/r {4d6}[persistent,slashing]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Slashing Damage} (basic Reflex save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher). On a critical failure, targets also become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

You Failed to Account For... This!.name: 没想到吧！ You Failed to Account For... This!
You Failed to Account For... This!.description:
触发 一个你可以看到的生物对你进行一次攻击，并要对抗你的AC。

当你的敌人尝试攻击你，你总是能在最后一刻掏出一些古怪的发明从无论什么样的攻击中保护自己。描述一种你尝试用来从敌人的攻击中保护自己的装置——例如，当被电蜥蜴的电击打击Strike攻击时，你可能掏出一种特殊的接地闪电权杖，但这原本是你准备引来雷暴给自己的发明充能的玩意儿！按这种方式使用发明来防御意味着触发攻击的攻击骰需要对抗你的手艺Crafting DC而非你的AC。

由于你使用手艺Crafting DC替换了AC，任何AC上的减值都不适用，但这不会移除任何状态或其他导致这些减值的效果。例如，如果你 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及}，并使用了发明来防御偷袭，你仍然会在被命中时承受额外精准伤害，即使措手不及在AC上的-2减值不适用于你的手艺Crafting DC。

You're Next.name: You're Next
You're Next.description:
Trigger You reduce an enemy to 0 Hit Points

After downing a foe, you menacingly remind another foe that you're coming after them next.

Attempt an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to Demoralize a single creature that you can see and that can see you.

If you have legendary proficiency in Intimidation, you can use this as a free action with the same trigger.

Zephyr Guard Dedication.name: Zephyr Guard Dedication
Zephyr Guard Dedication.description:
Archetype @Compendium[pf2e.archetypes.Lr108TWazbuxxUzP]{Zephyr Guard}

As a Zephyr Guard, you're always vigilant against crime and threats to the city's safety. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks against attempts to Palm an Object, Steal, or Conceal an Object (including you're Seeking concealed objects). You become trained in Society and Katapesh Lore; if you were already trained, you become an expert instead.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Zephyr Guard archetype.
